title: Virtual Assistant – Real Estate Quality Control Specialist
description:
Virtual Assistant – Real Estate Quality Control Specialist



About Us

Chasing Daylight Studio is a fast-growing real estate media company based in Massachusetts. We specialize in professional photography, video, floor plans, virtual staging, and marketing media for real estate agents.



Our brand is built on two equal pillars:

• Exceptional quality

• Outstanding customer service

Quality is not negotiable. Every image, video, and floor plan we deliver represents our reputation.

We are seeking a highly detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to become our dedicated Quality Control Specialist. This is one of the most important roles in our company.

This person will serve as the final internal checkpoint before media is delivered to our clients.



Role Overview

The Quality Control Specialist is responsible for ensuring every photoshoot is complete, accurate, polished, and meets Chasing Daylight Studio’s quality standards before delivery.

This role requires exceptional attention to detail, strong judgment, and the ability to enforce quality standards consistently.

You will work closely with our editing team, AI editing tools, and our delivery platform to ensure every project meets our brand standards.

This is not a task-based role. This is an ownership role. You are responsible for protecting the integrity of our brand.



Core Responsibilities

Quality Control – Photos

• Carefully review all delivered photos for quality, consistency, and accuracy

• Ensure proper exposure, color balance, vertical alignment, composition, and overall professionalism

• Use AI editing tools to declutter, adjust, and improve photos when needed

• Apply virtual staging using AI tools when requested by clients

• Work with clients to adjust virtually staged furniture based on feedback

• Confirm all required photos are present and nothing is missing



Quality Control – Video 

This is one of the most challenging and important parts of the role.

• Carefully review all videos for smoothness, pacing, stabilization, transitions, and adherence to job instructions

• Ensure videos reflect a luxury, professional standard

• Verify editors followed all specific property instructions

• Identify any mistakes, quality issues, or missed details

• Clearly and professionally communicate required revisions to editors

• Return videos that do not meet our standards

You must be confident in enforcing quality standards. If something is not right, it does not get delivered.



Floor Plan Quality Control

• Review floor plans for accuracy and completeness

• Make room name adjustments when requested

• Work directly with clients if clarification is needed

• Ensure final floor plans are accurate before delivery



Delivery Management and Job Tracking

• Ensure no photoshoot job slips through the cracks

• Track projects from upload through final delivery

• Confirm all deliverables are complete before release

• Maintain organized file management systems

• Help maintain internal tracking systems and workflows

Organization and reliability are essential.



AI-First Workflow

This role requires comfort and experience working with AI-based editing tools.

• Use AI tools for decluttering, virtual staging, and minor image corrections

• Be comfortable learning and adapting to new AI platforms

• Apply strong visual judgment when using AI tools to ensure results meet brand standards

• Photoshop experience is helpful but not required

• If using Adobe products, you must provide your own subscription

AI tools assist the workflow, but human judgment drives quality.



Required Experience (Non-Negotiable)

Applicants must have:

• Prior Quality Control experience for a real estate media company

• Direct experience reviewing real estate photography and video

• Experience working with editors and requesting revisions

• Experience using AI editing tools for real estate media

• Strong command of the English language 

• At least one professional reference from a real estate media company verifying QC experience

Applicants without direct real estate media QC experience will not be considered.



Interview & Testing Process

Qualified applicants will be required to:

• Complete a practical QC test assignment

• Review sample photos and videos and clearly identify any quality issues or mistakes

• Critique provided media and explain what is wrong, what should be improved, and why

• Provide examples of prior QC work

• Explain their full QC process from start to finish

We are looking for candidates who can demonstrate strong visual judgment, attention to detail, and the ability to communicate feedback clearly and professionally.



Performance Expectations

• Delivery timelines will be monitored

• Accuracy and completeness will be monitored

• Responsiveness during agreed working hours is required

• Quality standards must be consistently maintained

You will be evaluated based on performance, attention to detail, reliability, and communication.



Trial Period

This position includes a 3-week paid trial period.

During this period:

• Your quality, speed, communication, and judgment will be evaluated

• Feedback will be provided regularly

• Continuation into a long-term role will be based on performance

We are looking for long-term tea
mbers, not short-term contractors.



Work Schedule

• Remote position

• Must be available during Eastern Time business hours

• Initial hours: Approximately 5 hours per week

• Expected growth to 30–40 hours per week as volume increases

Applicants must be willing to grow into a full-time role as the company scales.



Who This Role Is For

This role is for someone who:

• Takes pride in high standards

• Notices small mistakes others miss

• Is confident giving revision feedback

• Thrives in structured systems

• Wants to grow with a scaling company



Lastly, to be considered for this role you must provide a video introduction

title: Graphic Designer + Social Media Marketer
description:
I’m a chef by trade and former restaurant owner building a personal brand in the home cooking space.



I help busy parents create restaurant-worthy meals at home without rigid meal plans, Sunday marathons, or recipe dependency. My content focuses on systems, confidence, flexibility, and chef-level thinking made practical.



I’m looking for a graphic designer who also understands marketing psychology — someone who can spot patterns in high-performing content and turn ideas into scroll-stopping, high-retention carousels.



This is not just a “make it look pretty” role.

You’ll be thinking strategically.



What You’ll Be Doing



Analyzing my Instagram account to identify:

What hooks are working

What carousel structures hold attention

What design styles perform best

Studying competitors in the cooking / meal planning / parent niche



Turning my raw ideas, scripts, voice notes, or long-form content into:

High-converting Instagram carousels

Educational but engaging visual breakdowns

Pattern-based layouts that improve saves and shares

Sourcing stock images, food visuals, textures, icons, etc.

Repurposing existing footage or content into new carousel formats

Occasionally suggesting content angles based on what’s performing

Designing within brand guidelines (clean, chef-inspired, confident, not cluttered)



You need to:



Have experience designing Instagram carousels that get saves and shares

Understand hooks, open loops, pattern interrupts, and content flow

Can design educational slides without them feeling boring

Know how to balance text, white space, and imagery



Understand marketing for:



Cooking, Parents, Meal systems, Educational content



This is NOT a basic Canva template plug and play job, and NOT for someone who needs constant micromanaging.



To Apply please include:



1) Links to 3-5 carousel posts you have created in the food / educational niche

2) What you think makes a carousel "save-worthy"

3) Your rate per hour (how many hours per carousel/slide). 

4) Start with the work MATRIX in your application so I know you read this properly.



This will be a long-term role for the right person.

If you understand how to turn educational cooking content into scroll-stopping visuals that build authority and drive conversions I’d love to hear from you.

Identify cost-effective growth opportunities and prioritize high-ROI initiatives.



Demand Generation & Lead Growth

Oversee
 marketing and lead nurturing workflows.

Team & Vendor Coordination

Build simple, scalable SOPs to improve marketing operations.



Requirements



6–10+ years of marketing experience.



Proven experience driving measurable growth in a small or mid-sized business.



Strong knowledge of digital marketing and funnel optimization.



Experience working remotely with international teams.



Excellent English communication skills.



Data-driven and ROI-focused mindset.



Preferred:

Compensation & Structure

Performance bonus tied to revenue growth and KPIs.



KPIs

Marketing-generated revenue



ROI on ad spend



Ideal Candidate

title: Senior U.S. Mortgage Underwriter (Non-QM) – Remote*
description:
Job Title: Senior U.S. Mortgage Underwriter (Non-QM) – Remote

Job Type: Full-Time | Remote

Experience Level: Senior / Managerial

Department: Mortgage Operations / Underwriting



About Us



We are a fast-growing U.S.-based mortgage company specializing in Non-QM and traditional loan solutions nationwide. As our organization continues to expand, we are seeking an experienced Senior Mortgage Underwriter with strong decision-making abilities, leadership potential, and advanced expertise in Non-QM loan products.



This role is ideal for someone who excels in a fast-paced lending environment, can operate independently, and consistently delivers accurate, compliant underwriting decisions.



Key Responsibilities



> Perform detailed credit, income, asset, collateral, and risk assessments for Non-QM, DSCR, Bank Statement, and alternative documentation loan types.

> Ensure all loan files meet investor guidelines, federal regulations, and internal credit standards.

> Review AUS findings and apply appropriate conditions, overlays, and exceptions.

> Issue clear, accurate underwriting decisions: approve, deny, or suspend with conditions.

> Collaborate with processors, loan officers, and managers to resolve conditions efficiently.

> Train and support junior underwriters as needed; ability to assist in managing the underwriting team.

> Maintain excellent turn times while ensuring quality and compliance.

> Participate in policy reviews, credit audits, and updates to underwriting guidelines.



Required Qualifications



> 7+ years of recent U.S. mortgage underwriting experience (required).

> Non-QM underwriting experience REQUIRED — including DSCR, Bank Statement, WVOE, P&L.

> Strong experience evaluating complex income scenarios and self-employed borrowers.

> Strong knowledge of U.S. lending regulations (TRID, ATR/QM, Fair Lending, etc.).

> Proficiency with Encompass is a plus.

> Excellent analytical skills and attention to detail.

> Ability to make independent decisions with minimal supervision.

> Comfortable working in a fully remote environment with strict loan-level security protocols.

> Preferred second language: Korean, Chinese, or Vietnamese.



Preferred Qualifications

> Prior leadership or team-lead experience (Team Lead, Supervisor, Senior Underwriter).

> Experience working in hybrid or remote U.S. mortgage operations.

> Familiarity with non-agency investors and their specific requirements.



Work Setup

Remote: Yes

Schedule: Must maintain partial overlap with U.S. business hours.

Compensation: Competitive salary based on experience and location; performance-based incentives available.



How to Apply

Please submit the following:

> Updated resume

> Brief summary of your Non-QM underwriting experience

> Expected monthly or annual salary

> Soonest availability



>>> Important: When you message us, always include the link to your resume to avoid delays in screening.

title: Real Estate Media Company Research Analyst
description:
Real Estate Media Company Research Analyst



About Us

Chasing Daylight Studio is a fast-growing real estate media company based in Massachusetts. We provide professional photography, video, floor plans, virtual staging, and marketing media for real estate agents.

We are committed to supporting our clients not just at the time of the photoshoot, but throughout the entire lifecycle of the listing.

We are seeking a detail-oriented Research Analyst to help us track listing outcomes and identify opportunities to better serve our clients.



Role Overview

The Real Estate Media Company Research Analyst is responsible for reviewing properties we have photographed and determining:

• When the property was listed

• Whether it has sold

• When it sold

• Whether it has expired, been withdrawn, or remains active

This role ensures we stay informed about our clients’ listings and allows us to:

• Congratulate agents when properties sell

• Offer additional marketing services if listings are not selling

• Strengthen long-term client relationships

• Identify repeat business opportunities

This is an operational research role focused on accuracy, consistency, and independent execution.



Core Responsibilities

• Review a weekly list of property addresses provided by Chasing Daylight Studio

• Research each address using designated real estate websites

• Determine listing date, current status, and sale date (if applicable)

• Accurately record findings in our tracking system

• Flag properties that meet follow-up criteria

• Provide a structured weekly report at an agreed-upon day and time

Accuracy is critical. Incorrect information directly affects client communication and business decisions.



Required Skills

• Strong attention to detail

• Ability to follow research procedures consistently

• Strong command of the English language

• Strong written communication skills

• Comfort navigating real estate listing websites such as 
, 
, and similar platforms

• Ability to organize findings clearly and accurately

• Reliable and deadline-driven

• Able to work independently without supervision

This role requires someone who can manage their time effectively, stay focused, and complete work accurately without being monitored.



Application Requirements

To be considered for this position, applicants must:

• Submit a short video introduction explaining their background and why they are a good fit for this role

• Demonstrate clear and professional spoken English

• Follow all application instructions carefully

• Include the word “consistency” somewhere in your video introduction

Applications submitted without a video introduction or without following instructions will not be considered.



Work Structure

• Part-time position

• Approximately 4 hours per week

• Work must be completed in one dedicated 4-hour block each week

• Flexible schedule, as long as weekly updates are delivered at the agreed-upon day and time

• Independent, low-touch role with clear expectations



Trial Period

This position includes a 3-week paid trial period.

During this period:

• Accuracy, reliability, and consistency will be evaluated

• Reports will be reviewed carefully for completeness and correctness

• Communication and timeliness will be assessed

Continuation beyond the trial period will depend on demonstrated accuracy and dependable performance.

Accuracy in reporting is essential to the success of this role. Consistent errors or incomplete research will result in the position not moving forward.



Compensation & Payment

• Payment will be issued bi-weekly on Fridays via Remitly

• Payments are processed on Fridays



Performance Expectations

• Reports must be accurate and complete

• Updates must be delivered consistently at the scheduled time

• No listings should be skipped

• Information must be clearly documented

Consistency and accuracy are non-negotiable for long-term success in this role.

description:
We’re a family-owned clothing brand based in the USA (our target audience = moms), looking for a Social Media Content Marketing Specialist to join our team! We’re looking for someone who’s excited to be an A-Player on our team -who shares our enthusiasm and drive to make great things happen together.

What You’ll Do:



1. Social Media Brand Management & Content Creation:

We’re looking for someone with ideas and execution skills to ensure our social media presence is engaging and aligned with our brand goals. This role is heavily focused on creating high-performing content that increases engagement and sales.



- Create organic and paid Instagram content, stories, and Reels to drive engagement, following brand aesthetics and messaging.

- Develop and execute a content plan that aligns with monthly brand goals & KPIs while fostering a strong, engaged community. Storytelling skills are a plus!

3. Community Management

- Monitor ad comments, assisting with customer inquiries or directing them to the right tea
mber



4. Partnership & Collaboration Management

- Organize co-giveaways and brand collaborations to expand brand reach

- Maintain an organized record of all partnerships and track their success





If you’re a creative, data-driven social media content marketer passionate about growing an engaged community, we’d love to hear from you!



How to respond:

1. Reply to this job posting with a link to your resume and example of work you have done

2. In the subject line of your application, include the word “Dress” at the end. Why? This lets us see who is actually paying attention :).

3. Use 8 points to apply. Applications with fewer than 8 points will not be considered.

title: ELITE SHORT-FORM VIDEO EDITOR
description:
???? ELITE SHORT-FORM VIDEO EDITOR for THE STELLARIS COLLECTION

Luxury Watch Brand | AI Video Specialist | High-Impact Reels/TikTok



THE MISSION

We are The Stellaris Collection.

We are building one of the most dominant luxury watch brands on social media.

Rolex. Patek Philippe. Audemars Piguet. FP Journe. Richard Mille.

Now we’re scaling aggressive short-form content.

This is not normal editing.

This is high-impact, scroll-stopping, retention-engineered video.

If your edits don’t command attention in the first 2 seconds, this role is not for you.



WHAT YOU’LL BE DOING

You will turn raw 4K footage into:

• Instagram Reels

• TikToks

• YouTube Shorts

You will:

• Edit 20–30 short-form videos per month (20–60 seconds each)

• Chop long footage into 5–10 viral-ready clips

• Engineer first-2-second hooks that pattern interrupt

• Design fast, clean, intentional transitions

• Create luxury-grade captions and overlays

• Integrate AI-generated video elements seamlessly

• Color grade metals, diamonds, and skin tones properly

• Deliver most edits within 24–48 hours

Some deliveries will be urgent. Days, not weeks.

Speed is part of the job.



AI INTEGRATION IS REQUIRED

You must actively use AI video tools such as:

• Runway

• Sora

• Kling

• Pika

• Veo

• Flow

• Descript

• OpusClip

• Higgsfield

We expect:

• AI-generated motion elements blended into real footage

• Surreal overlays or cinematic enhancements

• Workflow acceleration using AI tools

• Creative experimentation monthly

If you’ve never integrated AI video into real client work, this is not a fit.



HARDWARE REQUIREMENTS (NON-NEGOTIABLE)

You must have:

• High-end workstation

• 32GB+ RAM minimum

• Strong GPU capable of handling 4K timelines

• Reliable fiber-level internet

• Ability to receive and upload 100GB+ project folders

If your computer struggles with heavy timelines, do not apply.



WHAT “ELITE” MEANS HERE

You understand:

• Retention psychology

• Pattern interrupts

• Hook pacing

• Viral structure

• Energy control

• Scroll behavior

You don’t just cut clips.

nts.

COMPENSATION STRUCTURE

title: Dispatch Coordinator
description:
Join Binners – a fast-growing construction services company in Toronto, Canada.



Binners provides bin rentals, demolition, waste removal, and construction support services across the Greater Toronto Area. Reliability is our brand, and Dispatch is at the core of delivering on that promise every single day.



If you’re organized, calm under pressure, and enjoy coordinating people, trucks, and timelines in a fast-paced environment, we want you on our team.



About the Role

As a Dispatcher, you will be responsible for coordinating daily operations across our bin rentals, waste removal, and demolition services.

You will work closely with drivers, field teams, sales, and operations to ensure jobs are scheduled efficiently, executed correctly, and communicated clearly.

This is a full-time remote role based in the Philippines, working Toronto business hours.



Responsibilities

-- Scheduling and dispatching bin deliveries, pickups, swaps, and service jobs

-- Assigning drivers and crews to trucks for each shift

-- Monitoring the live schedule and making real-time adjustments as issues arise

-- Creating and updating orders for overages, overfills, failed attempts, access issues, and other site charges

-- Communicating with drivers, team leads, and internal staff throughout the day

-- Confirming all deliveries and pickups are properly documented

-- Keeping dispatch trackers, bin trackers, and internal systems fully up to date

-- Coordinating with sales to validate schedules and ensure nothing is missed

-- Identifying inefficiencies in routing, scheduling, or resource allocation

-- Preparing clear end-of-shift handoffs with all relevant information

-- Escalating issues when needed and following established escalation paths



Requirements

-- Experience in dispatch, logistics, construction operations, or field services

-- Strong organizational and time management skills

-- Ability to manage multiple moving parts in a fast-paced environment

-- Clear and professional communication skills, written and verbal

-- Comfortable working with drivers and field teams

-- Strong attention to detail and follow-through

-- Ability to work independently and make sound decisions

-- Comfortable using internal systems, trackers, and scheduling tools

-- Stable internet connection, reliable computer, and quiet workspace

-- Willing to work Toronto timezone hours



Nice to Have

-- Experience in construction, waste, logistics, or transportation

-- Familiarity with bin rentals, demolition, or job-site operations

-- Experience coordinating multiple trucks or crews

-- Understanding of access issues, service exceptions, and site constraints

-- Experience working with Canadian companies or operations

title: Outbound Appointment Setter – 8+ Apply Points - Full-Time – US Home Services (Roofing/Restoration)
description:
About Us

ProCraft Restoration Group is a premium residential restoration and remodel company serving the Southeast US (roofing, exterior, interior, energy efficiency upgrades). We're a stable, growing team building an inside sales outbound department.

Your Role – Straightforward & Focused

Your ONLY job: Make high-volume outbound calls to our warm database (past happy customers + previous leads) ? follow a proven script ? qualify interest ? book in-home appointments for our local reps ? log everything in CRM. No closing sales – just setting appointments.

Daily Responsibilities



100–150 outbound dials/day to warm contacts.

Use our script to re-introduce company/services (lifetime warranties, expanded offerings), ask key questions (main need: roof/exterior/interior/energy), and book specific day/time with correct specialist.

Log calls, notes, outcomes, and move contacts in pipeline (e.g., New ? Attempting ? Appointment Set) in GoHighLevel (GHL).

Send templated follow-up SMS when needed.

Hit daily/weekly appointment targets consistently.



Must-Have Qualifications



Excellent spoken English: Neutral/light accent that's clear and easy for US homeowners.

Proven outbound/cold calling + appointment-setting experience (US clients preferred; ideal: roofing, solar, HVAC, real estate, insurance, home services).

Comfortable with high volume (100+ dials/day) and handling "no's" frequently.

Quiet home office, reliable high-speed internet, quality headset with mic.

Available for US EST hours (overlap with PH night/morning shifts common in call center roles).



Nice-to-Have (Big Advantages)



Experience with GoHighLevel (GHL), JobNimbus, Salesforce, HubSpot, or similar CRMs.

Background in home services industries.



What We Offer



Stable full-time, long-term role with a reputable US company.

Competitive pay + generous bonuses (e.g., per shown appointment + team targets).

Full training, proven scripts, clear KPIs – you'll know exactly how to succeed.

Growth path: Top performers can advance to senior setter or team lead.



How to Apply – Serious Applicants Only

To be considered, reply with:



1. A short voice recording (30–60 seconds) introducing yourself + your outbound experience (use Vocaroo, Loom, or any link).

2. Summary of your appointment-setting/cold-calling experience:

-Industries/companies you've called for.

-What you promoted/sold.

-Typical daily dials and appointments booked per day/week.



3. Your available hours in EST (e.g., full 9 AM–5 PM EST availability).

4. Expected hourly rate + if you're open to per-appointment bonuses.



Subject line / First line of your application message MUST be:

“I can make 100+ calls/day and book appointments.” with a minimum of 8 apply points (show that you're serious).

We're seeking disciplined, phone-strong performers ready for consistent high-volume work with rewards for results. If this matches your skills and you can commit long-term, apply now – we respond quickly to qualified candidates!

title: Make.com Automation Builder
description:
Job Brief: 
 Automation Builder

Automated Reporting Pipeline - Meta Ads + Go High Level





Project type

One-off build (with potential ongoing retainer)



Engagement type

Gig



Platform


 (Integromat)



Data sources

Meta Ads API + Go High Level API



Output

Google Sheets - daily raw data + rolling dashboard



Number of clients

8 (separate Business Managers and GHL accounts)



Timeline

To be agreed - phased delivery expected





Project Overview

I run an acquisition-focused consultancy managing Meta ad campaigns for 8 clients. Currently I spend approximately 2 hours every Monday manually pulling data fro
ta Ads Manager and Go High Level, then consolidating it into a weekly snapshot spreadsheet.



I need a 
 automation specialist to build a pipeline that pulls this data automatically on a daily basis and populates a structured Google Sheet. The sheet will have two layers: a raw daily data tab and a rolling dashboard tab showing 3-day, 7-day, and 30-day snapshots.



This is not a complex build in terms of logic, but it requires genuine hands-on experience with the Meta Marketing API and Go High Level API specifically - not just general Make experience.





Scope of Work

Phase 1 - Single Client Build

Build the full pipeline for one client first. This is a deliberate checkpoint before scaling to all 8 accounts. Phase 2 only proceeds once Phase 1 is working correctly and I have signed off on it.



Data Sources

Meta Marketing API

Daily spend per ad account

Impressions

Reach

Frequency

Link clicks

CTR (link click-through rate)

CPC (cost per link click)

CPM

Click > Landing page views%

Results (purchases / conversions) - NOTE: the conversion event name varies per client account and must be configurable per client, not hardcoded

Cost per result



Go High Level API

Page views (sales page)

Leads / opt-ins

Sales volumes by product tier: Core Offer, Bump, OTO1, OTO2 (naming is generic - actual product names vary per client but map to these tiers)



Google Sheet Architecture

Tab 1 - Raw Daily Data

One row per day per client

All API-pulled fields listed above as columns

A 'Notes / Change Log' column (manually filled by me - to track creative changes, headline tests, offer changes etc.)

Data overwrites the last 3 days on each run to account for Meta's attribution window (conversions are backdated up to 48 hours)



Tab 2 - Rolling Dashboard

Aggregated views: rolling 3-day, 7-day, and 30-day windows, auto-calculated from today's date

Calculated metrics derived from raw data: CPA, AOV, ROAS, EPC, Sales Page CVR%, Bump CVR%, OTO1 CVR%, OTO2 CVR?shboard tab uses sheet formulas only - no additional API calls

One dashboard tab per client, or a consolidated multi-client view - to be discussed



All calculated metrics (CPA, ROAS, CVR% etc.) are formula-driven in the sheet. The automation only needs to supply the raw numbers. Do not build calculated metrics into the Make scenario.





Trigger and Schedule

Daily trigger - runs once per day, preferably between midnight and 6am AEST

Pulls previous day's data plus refreshes last 3 days to handle Meta attribution window

Must handle failures gracefully - if one client's API call fails, the scenario should continue for remaining clients and log the error



Multi-Account Handling

This is the most technically important requirement. All 8 clients are on separate Meta Business Managers and separate Go High Level accounts. The builder must have a clear approach to handling this before starting work.



No single token covers all clients - each account requires its own API connection or token

The approach to managing multiple BM tokens (refresh, expiry, re-auth) must be documented and handed over

GHL accounts are also separate instances - same requirement applies

Each client should have their own independent Make scenario so failures are isolated per account.

I will provide access credentials once approach is agreed



What I Am Not Looking For

Someone who will 'figure it out' on my budget - you should have done this before

A Zapier builder who has dabbled in Make - Make-specific experience required

Someone who has only connected a single Meta ad account - multi-BM experience specifically

A build that works once and breaks when a token expires with no documentation on how to fix it



Required Experience


 - demonstrated, not claimed. Show me a live example or describe a comparable build in your application

Meta Marketing API - specifically experience with multi-account / multi-BM setups and token management

Go High Level API - experience pulling funnel/CRM data

Google Sheets integration via Make

Experience handling API authentication, token refresh, and error handling in Make scenarios



Bonus (not required for Phase 1)

Google Sheets dashboard / formula build experience - if you can handle both the pipeline and the dashboard logic that is a bonus but not a requirement



Deliverables

The following must be delivered and signed off before payment for each phase:



Working Make scenario(s) pulling daily data fro
ta and GHL into Google Sheets

Sheet populated with at least 2 weeks of historical data for the Phase 1 client on handover

Written documentation covering: how the scenario works, how to add a new client, how to handle token expiry and re-authentication for both Meta and GHL, and what to do when a scenario errors

A 30-minute walkthrough call on handover (Zoom/Loom) explaining what was built and how to maintain it



How to Apply

Do not send a generic application. I will not respond to copy-paste cover letters.



In your application please answer the following specifically:



Have you connected multiple separate Meta Business Managers in a single Make scenario? If yes, describe how you handled token management across accounts.

Have you built a Make scenario that pulls data from Go High Level? If yes, what data were you pulling and what was the use case?

Describe how you would handle the Meta attribution window (conversions backdated 24-48 hours) in a daily data pull scenario.

What happens in your scenarios when one API call fails mid-run? Walk me through your error handling approach.

Provide either a link to a comparable live scenario (can be anonymised) or a brief description of the most similar project you have built.



These five questions are a screening filter. If you cannot answer questions 1 and 3 specifically, this project is not the right fit.





Budget and Scope Note

This is scoped as a one-off build with a phased approach - Phase 1 is one client, Phase 2 is the remaining 7. I have additional automation projects beyond this one and am looking for someone I can work with on an ongoing basis if Phase 1 goes well.



Please quote for Phase 1 (single client pipeline + documentation) and Phase 2 (scaling to 8 clients) separately in your application.

title: Business Development Rep (BDR) for growing SaaS company
description:
I'm going to start this very differently than a typical job posting. :-)  And that is, we thought we had an excellent opportunity for BDRs in our company, but we were becoming uncertain because we have had 4 hires in a row who failed miserably in a row (not all from this website.)



Until we found a new BDR, one of the wives of an employee who managed a restaurant and no longer was employed said that she would help out and make some phone calls for us.  She has zero experience as a BDR, but she is smart, works a full day, is aggressive, and enjoys talking to people on the phone.



As of February 26 when I am writing this, she has set 23 meetings for the month so far, with our perfect Ideal Customer Profile (including about 50?ing Director, VP, Global ___, or Head of ____ - so this isn't just time-wasters who have nothing better to do than waste our time with a meeting.)  She's had over a 90% show-up rate so far.



Again, she is smart, and we're not going to expect everybody to start off that well.  But it is now obvious that it can be done, so especially if you have experience as a BDR and are willing to learn, participate, and work a full day, you should do extremely well here.  From a great deal of research and surveys, we believe that we are paying toward the very top of the pay scale for this kind of position, so we expect very strong candidates.



===========



So, after that unusual start, I will tell you more about the position below. 



Generally, we are looking for a full-time Business Development Representative (BDR) with at least 6 months of cold outreach experience. This experience is mandatory, because this job is not for everyone - trust me, I know because I did it for many years myself.  (While our current person does not have experience, her husband has worked with us for many years, so we waived the requirement.)



We will supply the contacts, the scripts, and all of the technology and tools, so you won’t have to do any of that yourself.  Note that we do NOT want a "robot" who reads a script - the script is a framework for you to use at the beginning as you are learning, but the best thing you can possibly do is have a real conversation and ask questions, rather than reading a script in a monotone voice.



We are a young and fast-growing SaaS company, which is exciting and fun to be a part of. (But don’t worry, the company leadership team has built and grown similar companies in the past.) So, they know what it takes to do it right, and are also understanding and reasonable – they will not make ridiculous demands of you, or micro-manage you.



Further, the Chief Marketing Officer has worked with Filipino workers for over 10 years, and understands how things work in the Philippines pretty well. Also, the CEO and CMO together helped run a department of 14 BDRs for years, so they understand what is reasonable in terms of activity, achievement, etc. They are both very much biased toward quality over quantity.



The position itself will be to do both warm and cold outreach, using primarily phone and
, but potentially LinkedIn as well. The industry we work with is the manufacturing industry, focusing specifically on the quality aspects – quality audits, inspections, etc.  



90% of the companies we call on are in Europe and North and South America. There are very few prospects of ours in the Asia Pacific region.



As such, the working hours usually start with morning time in Eastern/Central Europe, and finish with Eastern and Central Time in the US (very few prospects are on Pacific or Mountain Time.) That means that there is a degree of flexibility in terms of hours, to help fit into your life. For example, you could start calling/emailing at 9:00am Central European Time, work several hours in the European region in general, and then work a few hours as it turns 8:00am Eastern Time in the US, and be done by 11:00am Eastern Time. (That’s just an example – you could start later and finish later, or start earlier and finish earlier, or whatever.)



If you can only work European hours or only work US hours, that could work as well, and we could just focus you on one region, so let's talk further about that.



We will provide a HubSpot account, and an Internet-based phone like DialPad or AirCall or similar, a Microsoft 365 account, research tools like Lusha and FullEnrich, and are open to almost anything which makes you more effective.



Finally, we need to have a very high level of English fluency for this position. A minimal accent is preferred, but that is not as important as being able to speak clearly, with correct singular/plural usage, correct verb tenses, and so on. 



Generally, I am always extremely impressed with the English of the Filipinos that I work with, but this is extremely important because have a company based on offering a solution to the *quality* world, so everything we do must be high quality.



I can provide you with a large amount of additional information about the position, but prefer to answer questions directly so that I don’t overwhelm you with too much information at once! Please, let me know what questions you have, and let’s see if we can build a great relationship together.



To move forward, please send back a reply telling me SPECIFICALLY why this position would be a good fit for you.  You can write a few sentences or a few paragraphs - I will read it all.  Finally, ensure that you have your CV/resume posted in your reply so that I can review it - thanks.



Summary

-------------

Position: Full-time

Hours: Generally to follow European and Eastern American time zones

Experience required: 6 months of cold outreach MANDATORY

English level needed: Very high



Finally, when you apply, it is ***essential*** that you use 3 Apply Points in your application.

title: ???? Full-Time YouTube Editor (8–13 Minute Authority Videos | HeyGen AI | FinTech-Level Polish)
description:
We are hiring a long-form YouTube editor to produce 8–13 minute authority-driven educational videos using HeyGen AI avatars.



Our audience: luxury and mass-affluent home sellers.



Our visual standard: FinTech-level polish — clean, layered, intelligent, restrained.



This is not flashy influencer editing.

This is strategic, data-driven, high-trust visual storytelling.



If you consider 3–4 minutes long-form, this role is not for you.



We Are Looking For



Long-form YouTube retention specialists



AI production operators



Documentary-level YouTube editors



Retention-focused long-form specialists



Strategic narrative thinkers



You should have:



Impeccable taste in pacing and visual restraint



Advanced layering ability (B-roll, motion, data overlays)



Clean typography sense



Strong sound design discipline



Ability to edit for authority, not entertainment



Our Style



Think:



FinTech polish

Minimalist but layered

Intelligent visual reinforcement

Subtle motion graphics

Data-backed authority tone

Clean color grading

No gimmicks

No random stock footage



This channel speaks to affluent sellers making high-value decisions.



Every frame must reflect credibility.



What You Will Do



Format scripts for HeyGen AI avatar delivery



Manage full HeyGen render workflow



Build structured 8–13 minute authority edits



Integrate strategic B-roll and data visuals



Layer motion graphics with restraint



Maintain strong retention pacing



Deliver polished YouTube-ready exports



This Is NOT For You If



You specialize in TikTok/Reels/Shorts



Your style relies on flashy transitions



Your portfolio shows random stock placement



You have not edited long-form YouTube (8+ minutes)



You cannot demonstrate layered, intelligent storytelling



Compensation



Full-time long-term position.

Competitive monthly rate based on skill and experience.

Growth path available for high performers.



To Apply



Start your application with the word: ARCHITECT



Share 2–3 long-form YouTube videos (8+ minutes) you personally edited



Confirm experience with HeyGen AI or similar tools



Briefly describe how you maintain retention in 10-minute authority videos



Applications missing these will not be reviewed.



Skill Requirements

1?? Long-Form YouTube Mastery



Proven editing of 8–13 minute YouTube videos (minimum)



Strong understanding of retention pacing and rhythm shifts



Ability to build narrative flow — not just cut clips



Comfortable editing authority-driven educational content



2?? Advanced Editing Craft



Expert-level Adobe Premiere Pro



Strong After Effects capability (motion graphics + data visuals)



Clean, professional sound design and audio balancing



Advanced B-roll layering (intentional, not random placement)



Strong typography and visual hierarchy sense



Ability to edit with restraint and taste (FinTech-level polish)



3?? AI Production Capability



Hands-on experience with HeyGen (preferred)



Ability to format scripts for AI-avatar delivery



Understanding of pacing adjustments for AI voice



Experience managing avatar rendering workflow



4?? Strategic Thinking



Understands viewer psychology and retention curves



Knows how to reinforce ideas visually (not decorate them)



Can interpret data-heavy content without oversimplifying it



Thinks in terms of narrative structure and leverage



5?? Professional Discipline



Meets deadlines consistently



Organized file structure



Clear communication



Open to structured feedback and iteration

title: L2 Tech Support Engineer
description:
Dear Technology Lover!

We're a small (but VERY efficient) 20-year-old MSP based in Arizona.

As a small company. we're VERY employee-focused, and believe that our tea
mbers are our MOST IMPORTANT ASSET!



Here are some of the things you can expect from working with us:

• Ongoing (monthly) manager review and feedback- you should never guess where you are "standing" and what you, AND THE COMPANY, can do better!

• Paid certifications- we will pay for your courses, and tests and allocate time during business hours to help you achieve your desired goals

• Paid Time Off- it's important to us that you are happy, healthy, and have a work-life balance!

• Bonuses- when the company wins- you win!

• Raises- As we grow, we believe you should as well. We have to stay competitive as an employer to retain our awesome employees!

• Opportunities to grow- In our industry, we can't be on "cruise control"... We need to push our tea
mbers to stay ahead of the technology curve. Help you continually to sharpen your skills with a focus on your career aspirations.

• Paid sick days- We understand life happens. We don't want you to feel that you have to drag yourself to work sick if your body tells you to relax...



You're the right fit if you:

• LOVE learning, working with, and experimenting with new technology

• Get excited when you save someone's day and provide great service

• Are a hard-working fun person, and see yourself being in the IT industry for the foreseeable future

• Want to work in a GROWING environment, with STABLE income, Bonuses, and a great attitude!

• Want the opportunity to advance and learn more!



Some of the responsibilities that your position will include are:

Helpdesk (mostly escalations, but some basic if needed), cyber security related tasks/ audits, cloud hosting and virtualization (HyperV, SonicWall, VPN), MS365 management and automation, BCDR (Axcient), networking (Unifi, Sonicwall), IT projects, Servers maintenance (Windows only), scripts creation, testing new technology and other tasks related to IT.



IMPORTANT:

This position requires AT LEAST 2 years of MSP experience and at least 2 years experience in an L2 position, supervisory, or lead role. 100% clean background check, highly organized, technologically savvy, and can work diligently with little 
veral hiring steps will take place to verify the above requirements, including reference checking, employment verification, technical testing, and more.



Minimum technical level that you will need to be able to pass a test on:

• Explaining to a non-technical person what the "cloud" is

• Consulting with a new client on what BCDR solution you would recommend to an SMB, and why

• Explaining what the differences are between traditional anti-virus and XDR

• Creating a new Virtual Machine on Hyper-V host, from an ISO file located on a different computer on the network.

• Explaining the differences and commonalities between SharePoint and OneDrive.

• Creating an Intune policy that will install Firefox on an Azure-joined VM, and make Firefox the default browser, with the specific home page we'll provide to you during the test.

• Several other situational and technical questions.

• CCNA certificate candidates preferred but not required.



MORE DETAILS:

• A PRE-EMPLOYMENT BACKGROUND CHECK is performed (at our expense). You must have 100% clean background check. Please do not apply if you don't have 100% clean background check.

• Personality is KEY for us. We are looking for an easy-going, yet professional, friendly and HONEST person.

• You will be working from home. This means you must have a quiet work environment and no excessive background noise.

• FAST AND RELIABLE INTERNET SERVICE IS REQUIRED With at least 100Mbps download speed  20+Mbps upload speed.

• As part of this position requirement, you must have a computer that will be used exclusively for your work with us. This means we will be installing our security software on that computer, will remove admin rights from you, and monitor/ control it for security and compliance reasons. In return, we will pay you additional “rent” fees, on top of your salary, in the amount of several hundred dollars. Details about this “rental” will be discussed during your second interview. There are minimum requirements that your computer must have, in order to be employed with us. You must have a Computer/Laptop with at least i5 minimum 9th gen processor (preferably a newer one) with 16 GB RAM or more or Ryzen 5/7 (MUST include TPM support) as well as Windows 11 OS.

• You must have recently worked on a night shift for 2 consecutive years or more.

• We evaluate/ review employees monthly and provide consistent feedback.

• We offer raises and bonuses according to performance, certifications, attitude, and customer reviews twice/ year.

• Your manager (our IT director) will create a roadmap for your "KPIs" and certifications track. We always push our team to earn certifications and additional knowledge – even allowing “disconnect study time” during business hours!

• On-call rotation (after-hours) for a week at a time, once every 4-5 weeks. It's VERY rare that we get calls after-hours (the average is only twice/ year!).

• We're closed on major US holidays, and at the completion of the first 3 months of employment, you'll qualify for paid holidays.

• Work hours are Mon-Fri at 8 am till 5:30 pm (UTC-07:00 , MST, Arizona time zone)

• Every 4 to 5 weeks, you'll be working 1/2 day on a Saturday (project work/catch-up work) and get 1/2 day off the week after

• Mandatory 1-hour lunch and additional breaks (as you need those) throughout the day.

• Further details and information will be discussed with qualified candidates.



EXPERIENCE REQUIRED:

• REQUIRED: Relevant minimum 2 YEARS experience working for an MSP

• REQUIRED: With AT LEAST 2 years experience in an L2 position, supervisory or lead role.

• REQUIRED: Microsoft Azure AD/ M365 experience

• REQUIRED: Experience working with an RMM and PSA software (DATTO preferred)

• Preferred: Cyber Security education/experience

• Preferred: Hyper-V experience



Other tools we use:

Barracuda DNS filter, AutoElevate, Cylance, Infocyte, Syxsense, IT Glue, SonicWall, Unifi, and more



HOW TO APPLY?



Answer the questions below, or you may also send an
 to 
 with the subject line "L2 Tech Support - Feb2026" with your answers:



- An attachment of your resume in PDF format/ link of you resume if you will send us a message.

- A confirmation (simple written statement) that you have a 100% clean background with no criminal history.

- A confirmation (simple written statement) that you understand the business hours (MST\ Arizona time zone.



Answer the following questions:

1. How many years of experience do you have working in an MSP company? Name of the MSP company/s you worked with.

2. Do you have at least 2 years experience in an L2 position, supervisory or lead role?

3. Do you have experience working with RMM and PSA software? What applications did you use?

4. Do you have experience working with Virtualization, servers, GPO, TCP/IP, hyper-v/vmware, conditional access, Intune, and Scripting such as PowerShell?

5. Have you recently worked on a night shift for 2 consecutive years or more? What time zone and when?

6. Are you okay with the computer requirements and the rental arrangement described in the job details?

7. Do you have an internet speed of at least 100Mbps download speed and  20+ upload speed?



We're looking forward to having you join our family!

title: Family Law Paralegal
description:
The Family Law Paralegal will provide comprehensive litigation support in complex divorce, custody, child support, and post-decree matters. The ideal candidate is organized, proactive, and capable of managing sensitive cases with professionalism and discretion.



Key Responsibilities



Draft pleadings, motions, financial disclosures, and discovery requests/responses

Prepare and organize financial affidavits and supporting documentation

Manage case files from intake through trial and post-decree proceedings

Communicate with clients, opposing counsel, court staff, and third parties

Assist in trial preparation, including exhibit organization and witness coordination

Maintain calendaring of court deadlines and ensure compliance with procedural rules

Coordinate mediation, hearings, and depositions

Conduct legal research as needed

Maintain strict confidentiality and professionalism at all times



Qualifications



Minimum 2–3 years of family law paralegal experience (Colorado experience preferred)

Strong understanding of Colorado Rules of Civil Procedure and family law process

Experience handling high-asset and complex financial cases preferred

Proficiency in Microsoft Office and legal case management software

Exceptional written and verbal communication skills

Ability to manage multiple cases simultaneously

High level of discretion, professionalism, and client sensitivity

title: Medical Biller (KIPU Experience Required)
description:
We already operate a successful U.S.-based business and are now expanding our healthcare team. We’re looking for someone reliable, detail-oriented, and experienced in behavioral health billing.



About Us

We are a high-end rehabilitation clinic providing premium care services in the United States. Our team values professionalism, accuracy, discretion, and efficiency.



Position Overview

The Medical Biller will be responsible for managing the full billing cycle for our rehab facility, ensuring clean claims submission, proper insurance follow-ups, and timely reimbursements.



Requirements (PLEASE DO NOT APPLY IF YOU DO NOT HAVE THESE)



Proven experience with KIPU EMR (REQUIRED)

Minimum 2+ years of medical billing experience

Experience in behavioral health / rehab billing (highly preferred)



Strong understanding of:

Insurance verification

Claims submission (electronic & manual)

Denial management & appeals

Payment posting & reconciliation

AR follow-ups

Familiar with U.S. insurance (PPO, HMO, Medicaid, Medicare)

Excellent English communication skills

High attention to detail

Stable internet connection

Ability to work U.S. business hours



Responsibilities

Insurance verification and benefit checks

Submit and track claims using KIPU

Manage denials and resubmissions

Follow up on outstanding AR

Post payments and reconcile accounts

Communicate with insurance providers as needed

Ensure compliance with U.S. healthcare billing regulations



How to Apply

To be considered, please:

Put “KIPU BILLING PRO” in your subject line.

Include a short summary of your KIPU experience.

List the types of facilities you’ve billed for (rehab, detox, mental health, etc.).

Provide your expected monthly salary.

Attach your resume.

title: CONTENT RESEARCH EXPERT (CRE): $800 a month
description:
BENEFITS



- Full-time position: 7.5 hours/day

- Schedule: Monday to Friday, flexible time

- Salary: $800 a month

- Paid every two weeks via Wise. (direct to your bank account, almost no fees, no waiting for payday!)

- Full work-from-home flexibility

- A young, supportive team that values your output without micromanagement

- Clear growth path with opportunities to expand your role

- Join our international team working with established content creators and brands

- Work with the latest AI tools and social media platforms

- Research 30-50 viral short-form videos on Instagram Reels and TikTok

- Strategically select content ideas that will help specific clients go viral

- Copy/paste links to each content piece

- Analyze client information (niche, target audience, personality, content style)

- Create detailed instructions for content replication tailored to the client's abilities

- Think strategically about what will help each client succeed

- Maintain a content library categorized by niche for efficient future use

- Complete daily End-of-Day Reports (EOD)

- Attend multiple meetings with your manager each week

- Continuously improve content recommendations based on what works



REQUIREMENTS



- Excellent English skills (C1 or above - non-negotiable!)

- Previous experience in content creation is a MUST

- Experience in content research and trend analysis

- Strong understanding of what makes content go viral

- Knowledge of Instagram, TikTok, and YouTube Shorts features

- Strategic thinking and attention to detail

- Ability to provide clear, actionable instructions

- Reliable internet connection and professional home office setup

- 100% say-do ratio and commitment to deadlines



HOW TO APPLY



ROUND 1: Complete our application form and record a personal introduction:

Record a 3-minute Loom video introducing yourself (instructions in form)

ROUND 2: Qualified candidates will be invited for an interview.



MORE ABOUT US



We've been in the industry since 2019 and have worked with over 3000 clients. We currently receive around 80-100 new clients per month. We provide an "80% done-for-you content & monetization system" that helps creators go viral and turn views into income using short-form content, AI, and proven strategies.



MORE ABOUT US

title: Inside Sales Associate
description:
Inside Sales Agent (ISA) / Cold Caller – Auto Detailing & Ceramic Coating Leads

Full-Time | Remote (Philippines Only)

US Central Time (CST) Required

$600–$700/month 

We are a U.S.-based marketing agency that generates inbound leads for:

Auto detailing shops

Ceramic coating installers

High-end vehicle protection services

We are looking for a HIGH-PERFORMANCE Inside Sales Agent.

This is NOT a basic VA role.

Your main job is converting inbound car detailing & ceramic coating leads into booked appointments for our clients.



PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITY (MOST IMPORTANT)

You will:

Call ALL inbound leads immediately (under 5 minutes)

Qualify vehicle owners properly

Collect vehicle details (year, make, model, condition)

Identify buyer intent & budget

Overcome objections confidently

Book appointments directly into the client’s calendar

Enter detailed notes into GoHighLevel CRM

Move opportunities through pipeline stages correctly

Follow up via calls, SMS, and

Speed + Confidence + Sales Skill is everything.



Secondary Responsibility (Outbound Cold Calling)

When inbound volume is slower:

Call aged leads

Re-engage old estimates

Follow up with no-shows

Cold call provided data lists

Generate new appointments from outbound efforts

If you are uncomfortable with cold calling, this is not the right role.



We Are Looking For Someone Who:

Speaks VERY strong English (neutral accent preferred)

Sounds confident and persuasive on the phone

Has real SALES experience (not just script reading)

Can handle objections like:

“It’s too expensive”

“I need to think about it”

“I’ll call back later”

Understands urgency

Is competitive and performance-driven

Takes pride in booking appointments

Bonus if you understand:

High-ticket services

Automotive industry

Upselling / value-based selling



Technical Requirements

GoHighLevel experience (BIG PLUS)

CRM experience required

Stable internet (50+ Mbps)

Quiet workspace

Quality headset

Must work US CST hours consistently



KPIs

You will be measured on:

Speed to lead

Calls per day

Contact rate

Appointments set

Show-up rate

CRM accuracy



Compensation

$600–$700/month base (depending on experience)

Opportunity for long-term growth

Potential promotion to Sales Manager

High performers will earn more.



READ CAREFULLY – APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS

To be considered, you MUST include:

A 1–2 minute voice recording introducing yourself

A short video explaining your SALES experience

List of CRMs you’ve used (mention GoHighLevel if applicable)

Screenshot of internet speed

Put the word “DETAILER” in the first line of your application

Applications that do not follow instructions will be ignored.

ABOUT US







Young Publisher is an international digital marketing company working with content creators and online brands.



BENEFITS



- Full-time position: 8 hours daily, Monday-Friday; 40 hours a week

- Flexible schedule: Choose your own hours, as long as you show up for the daily meeting (MANDATORY)

- Stable income: Long-term role with regular, on-time payments

- Supportive team: Collaborative environment without micromanagement

- Growth path: Opportunities to increase responsibilities and earnings

- 100% remote: Work-from-home setup



TASKS



Client Support (maintaining 40-50 total clients):



- Run kickoff calls with new clients using our proven script

- Review client content and give actionable feedback

- Answer client messages within 24 hours

- Host weekly group calls and 1-on-1 coaching sessions

- Help clients overcome content blocks and limiting beliefs



Progress Tracking:



- Update daily/weekly reports

- Track client progress and next steps

title: Brand Designer (Café Startup – Remote)
description:
We are launching a specialty café concept in California focused on community, wellness, creativity, and culture. This is a from-scratch brand build under a medical group, and we are looking for a strong branding-focused designer to help shape the visual identity.



You will work directly with the Project Lead and play a key role in developing a cohesive and intentional brand system.



Responsibilities:

• Develop logo concepts and visual identity direction

• Establish brand color palette and typography system

• Design menus, packaging, signage mockups, and marketing materials

• Build a structured brand guideline deck

• Ensure consistency across all visual assets

• Execute revisions based on clear creative direction

• Support launch visuals and presentation materials



Requirements



• Strong branding portfolio (logos and identity systems required)

• Clean, modern design aesthetic

• Solid understanding of typography, layout, and hierarchy

• Ability to build cohesive visual systems (not just individual graphics)

• Proficient in Adobe Creative Suite and/or Canva

• Organized, responsive, and easy to collaborate with

• Comfortable working on PST schedule



Coffee or F&B branding experience is a plus, but strong graphic design foundation is required.

Applications without a branding-focused portfolio will not be reviewed.

title: Conference & Events Coordinator
description:
Role Overview



The Conference & Events Coordinator provides operational and administrative support for Fortra Conferences and related events. This role is responsible for maintaining conference systems, supporting attendee and sponsor coordination, assisting with marketing workflows, and helping ensure event information is accurate and up to date across platforms.

 

This position works closely with the Marketing, Events, and Graphics teams and supports senior conference leadership with execution and coordination.



________________________________________

Key Responsibilities

Conference Systems & Data Management

• Maintain and update Airtable, Wrike, and Cvent for all conferences

• Add and update attendee, sponsor, and speaker records across systems

• Regularly audit attendee and sponsorship tabs to ensure accuracy and consistency

• Upload attendee lists to Wrike and shared drives; assist with internal and partner distribution

• Update Airtable following mail merges and registration updates

________________________________________

Sponsor & Attendee Coordination

• Register confirmed sponsors in Airtable, Wrike, and Cvent

• Assist with tracking sponsorships, registrations, and deliverables

• Support attendee communications and internal reporting needs

________________________________________

Marketing & Website Support

• Maintain and update conference websites with current information

• Coordinate with the graphics team on:

 o Conference graphics

 o Sponsor materials

 o Speaker bios and headshots

 o Swag and signage requests

• Submit graphic request forms for approved, straightforward items

________________________________________

Project & Administrative Support

• Create Wrike projects for confirmed conferences

• Update marketing agendas, Wrike tasks, Excel sheets, and conference agendas based on meeting notes and leadership direction

• Create calendar invites for new conferences, meetings, and events

________________________________________

Travel & Event Logistics Support

• Assist with coordinating travel and hotel logistics with partners’ assistants once conference attendance is confirmed

• Book travel for the marketing team when applicable

________________________________________

Ideal Candidate

• Highly organized and detail-oriented

• Comfortable working across multiple systems and tools

• Strong follow-through and ability to take direction

• Clear written and verbal communicator

• Interest in conferences, events, and marketing operations

________________________________________

Specific Requirements:



(a) Proficiency in the English language

(b) Must have reliable power and internet connection

(d) Work Pacific Time (Main Office is located in California)

(e) Must own a personal laptop (Windows or Mac) with a valid, fully licensed operating system. Minimum specifications: Windows 10 or macOS 12, Intel Core i5-1235U 1.30 GHz processor (or Apple M1/M2 equivalent), and at least 16GB of RAM.

(f) Must complete a speed test, meet system specification requirements, and meet laptop specification requirements.



Hours: 8:30 am—5:00 pm, PT, Monday through Friday

Salary: $800-$1000 a month plus $75 supplemental pay to use toward health insurance

________________________________________

Next Steps: 

Send us a link to a PDF of your resume and include a brief explanation of why you think you're the best fit for this position.



We look forward to seeing your application!

title: Director of E-Commerce
description:
A growing, multi-location DTC apparel and retail company with both brick-and-mortar stores and a Shopify e-commerce operation is looking for a Director of E-Commerce / VP of Growth Execution to own the full e-commerce growth engine.

This is not a strategy-only role. This is a builder and integrator. The founder moves fast and generates ideas constantly: bundles, SKU changes, landing pages, offers, and new promotions. This person takes those ideas, builds them, launches them, tracks performance, and reports back with numbers. The founder should never touch execution.



We need someone who has lived inside a DTC brand, scaled revenue on Shopify, and owned the full growth stack from storefront to Klaviyo. Pure paid media buyers, creative directors, developers, and corporate marketing managers are not the right fit.



RESPONSIBILITIES

 1. Idea-to-Execution Engine

 2. Build landing pages and promotional pages directly in Shopify based on the founder’s direction.

 3. Coordinate with the designer on creative assets needed for each initiative.

 4. Set up offer logic, discount structures, pricing rules, bundle configurations, and collection architecture.

 5. QA the full checkout experience across devices and browsers before anything goes live.

 6. Push changes live on schedule, track performance from day one, and report back with clear data.

 7. CRO Testing Velocity



This is not about testing button colors. This is about meaningful experiments that move revenue.

 1. Run 2 to 4 structured CRO tests per month across the storefront.

 2. Rebuild hero product PDPs to maximize conversion and average order value.

 3. Execute bundle experiments and offer framing tests.

 4. Optimize checkout flow to reduce abandonment.

 5. Analyze heatmaps and session recordings to identify friction points and drop-off areas.

 6. Maintain a testing log with hypotheses, results, and learnings.

 7. SKU Rationalization & Hero Product Focus



Revenue scales when focus scales.

 1. Pull 90-day velocity reports to identify top and bottom performers.

 2. Kill the bottom 30% of underperforming SKUs. Push the top 10% with focused merchandising and dedicated landing pages.

 3. Create hero collections and simplify navigation to reduce decision fatigue.

 4. Provide regular catalog health reports with data-backed recommendations.

 5. Lifecycle Profit Engine 
 & SMS)



 and SMS are not afterthoughts. They are the margin expansion engine.

 1. Rebuild and optimize Klaviyo flows: welcome series, abandoned cart, post-purchase, win-back, and VIP sequences.

 2. Segment customers based on behavior, purchase history, and lifetime value.

 3. Increase repeat purchase rate and raise LTV so the business can scale ad spend profitably.

 4. Track and report on
/SMS revenue attribution, open rates, click rates, and conversion by flow.



REQUIREMENTS



Must-Have Qualifications

 1. Experience scaling a DTC apparel or e-commerce brand, ideally from $3M–10M into $15M–30M+.

 2. Deep Shopify fluency: Admin, theme customization (Liquid, HTML, CSS, JavaScript), Shopify Flow, checkout configuration, and catalog management.

 3. Proven CRO experience with documented conversion improvements, A/B test outcomes, and revenue impact. Data required, not descriptions.

 4. Working knowledge of Klaviyo: flow architecture, segmentation, and campaign management.

 5. Strong analytics skills using Shopify Analytics, Google Analytics (GA4), and e-commerce dashboards.

 6. Proficiency with Google Suite (Docs, Sheets, Drive, Gmail, Meet).

 7. Experience using AI tools (ChatGPT, Claude AI) for content, research, and workflow optimization.

 8. Familiarity with Basecamp or similar project management tools.

 9. Ability to work independently and deliver high-quality outputs without constant supervision.

 10. Reliable internet and ability to overlap with U.S. Eastern Time zone.



Preferred Qualifications

 1. Experience with Shopify Plus and advanced checkout customization.

 2. Knowledge of e-commerce SEO, site speed optimization, and technical SEO.

 3. Background in paid advertising strategy (Google Ads, Meta Ads) with understanding of how ad traffic converts on Shopify.



KEY TRAITS

 1. Calm Executor: Steady under pressure. Channels the founder’s energy into organized, executable plans.

 2. Process-Oriented: Builds systems and repeatable workflows. Brings structure without slowing things down.

 3. Metrics-Obsessed: Every decision backed by data. Every test has a hypothesis. Every report has numbers.

 4. Low Ego: The founder is the visionary. This person is the engine. Takes direction, executes with excellence, lets results speak.

 5. High Follow-Through: When they say it’s done, it’s done. No loose ends, no excuses.

 6. Transparent Communicator: Flags issues early. Provides honest updates. Honesty is non-negotiable.



TOOLS & PLATFORMS

Shopify (Admin, Liquid, Flow) — E-Commerce Platform — Required

HTML / CSS / JavaScript — Development — Required

Klaviyo —
 & SMS Marketing — Required

Google Analytics (GA4) — Analytics — Required

Google Suite — Productivity & Communication — Required

ChatGPT / Claude AI — AI Tools — Required

Basecamp — Project Management — Required

Meta Ads / Google Ads — Paid Media (Oversight) — Preferred



PORTFOLIO & APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS

 1. Portfolio or case study of at least one DTC/e-commerce brand you scaled, with revenue milestones, your role, and strategies implemented. Store links and screenshots expected.

 2. Documented CRO results: conversion improvements, A/B test outcomes, and revenue impact with real data.

 3. Examples of Klaviyo flows you built or optimized, with performance data.



HOW TO APPLY

Submit your resume, portfolio, and CRO case studies. Qualified candidates will be contacted for a pre-recorded video interview as the next step in the evaluation process.

title: Legal Assistant
description:
We are a law firm in Southern California with an offshore team of legal assistants. We’re looking to add another key tea
mber to our ranks for an immediate start.



We believe in technology. We harness it to our advantage. Understanding how to manage, adopt, train, and utilize new technologies is an essential requirement for all members of our organization.



What’s the work?



• Legal tasks such as preparation of pleadings, legal documents, e-filing with attorney services, process service, calendaring hearings and deadlines/reminders, etc.

• Respond to client
s within 30 minutes.

• Correspond with clients, gathering information and scheduling meetings with our litigation attorneys.

• Attend recurring meetings such as litigation meetings, process meetings, paralegal training, etc.

• Follow up on pending tasks.

• Answer phone calls courteously and professionally; listen and understand the reason for the client’s call.

• Remind attorneys about deadlines and hearings.



What skills and experience do we want and need?



• Experience in litigation required (including preparation/drafting of pleadings, proofs of service, discovery, litigation timeline, and trial preparation).

• Experience in bankruptcy is a plus.

• Experience in lender law, unlawful detainers, replevin, collections is a plus.

• Ability to manage workload and work well under pressure.

• Ability to take responsibility for tasks assigned from beginning to completion.

• Proficient in Excel, Word, Outlook, Zoho; knowledge of legal billing systems (ProLaw) is a plus.

• Some College Degree or equivalent.

• Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

• Savvy with technology applications.

• Strong internet connection.



Qualities:



• Reliable

• Accountable/Honest

• Observant

• Punctual

• Proactive

• Teachable



Working hours:



• Monday – Friday: 40 hours per week

• Must be willing to work at U.S./PST time:

• 7:00 am PST through 4:00 pm PST (11:00 pm through 7:00 am/next day Manila time) with one hour break.

• Change of schedule is subject to negotiation.



IT Requirements:

• Own a laptop with at least Windows 10, Processor I5 Core-1235U 1.30 GHz, 16GB

• Must complete a speed test, meet system specification requirements, and meet laptop specification requirements. Additional
 with more instructions will be sent as part of the application process.



Next Steps: PLEASE READ THE INSTRUCTIONS CAREFULLY BELOW.



To apply, please copy the link below and paste it into your browser to complete the application form. You will need a Google account to upload the required application materials.



Application Form Link: 





Please ensure that you provide the following as part of your application:

1. Resume (PDF version)

2. Writing Samples

3. Voice recording: Tell us about something you have accomplished, handled, or organized in a prior employment

4. Link to your profile on 

5. Answer the questions below in the Google Form:

• Legal experience in litigation is a requirement.

• What are the names/descriptions of pleadings or legal documents you prepared in previous employment?

• Were these documents filed with the court?

• If so, were you personally responsible for submitting pleadings or legal documents for filing with the court?

• If yes, did you use an attorney service? How was the filing submitted?

• Have you prepared pleadings for Trial preparation? What were the pleadings?

• Have you ever prepared a Proof of Service? What is its purpose?

• Describe your experience working with state court, federal court, or bankruptcy court.

• Have you ever contacted a court and spoken with a court clerk? If yes, please describe the purpose of the call and the type of information you handled.

• Have you ever worked remotely for a U.S. company? If yes, what was the State and what were the U.S. hours?

• What is your availability to start employment (i.e., immediately, need 2 weeks, etc.)?

title: Job Application Research & Recruiting Support Specialist (Remote)
description:
Talent Sourcing & Job Application Coordinator (Remote – US Job Market)



About the Role



I am a U.S.-based senior professional actively seeking new career opportunities and looking for a highly organized, detail-oriented Virtual Assistant to support my job search process. This role involves researching relevant job openings, submitting high-quality applications, and maintaining accurate tracking systems.



This is not a mass-application role. Accuracy, judgment, and professionalism are extremely important.



Responsibilities



• Research and identify relevant job postings based on defined criteria (job title, salary range, location, and industry)

• Apply only to roles that closely match provided guidelines

• Submit accurate and complete applications through company career portals and job boards

• Customize pre-written responses when required

• Maintain a detailed Google Sheet tracking all applications (company, role, link, date applied, status, notes)

• Monitor application confirmations and flag recruiter responses

• Ensure no duplicate applications are submitted

• Follow a structured daily workflow and meet agreed-upon targets



• Strong written English skills

• High attention to detail

• Ability to follow instructions precisely

• Experience using LinkedIn, Indeed, and other job boards

• Comfortable navigating U.S.-based company career portals

• Organized, reliable, and process-oriented

• Experience with Google Sheets or Excel



Preferred but not required:

• Experience supporting recruiting, HR, or sales professionals

• Familiarity with U.S. job market terminology



Work Structure



• Part-time (2–4 hours per day)

• Monday–Friday preferred

• Long-term potential based on performance

• Paid hourly



To Apply



Please include the phrase: “Process matters more than speed” at the top of your application and briefly describe how you ensure quality when submitting applications on someone else’s behalf.

description:

 ads. We want the AI agent to do outbound calls and appointment settings based on qualifications if the lead qualifies.
