title: Accountant (QuickBooks)
description:
We are seeking a proactive, detail-oriented Accountant to provide full-time, dedicated support for a growing business. This high-impact role focuses on financial management, bookkeeping, invoicing, payment processing, and executive reporting. You will act as a key tea
mber—ensuring all accounting tasks, reconciliations, and financial workflows are managed efficiently while supporting multiple growth initiatives.



This role is ideal for someone resourceful, detail-oriented, and confident navigating accounting software, online payment platforms, and complex financial workflows.



Responsibilities

Manage full-cycle accounting processes, including accounts payable, accounts receivable, and general ledger maintenance

Prepare and process invoices, payments, and expense reports accurately

Reconcile accounts and ensure financial records are up-to-date

Manage transactions and reporting in QuickBooks Online/Express

Support financial reporting, including monthly, quarterly, and year-end statements

Manage payroll processing and employee timekeeping

Assist with budgeting, forecasting, and financial analysis as needed

Maintain and update SOPs and internal workflows for recurring financial tasks

Communicate professionally with vendors, clients, and internal stakeholders regarding financial matters



Requirements



3+ years of experience as an Accountant



Experience with QuickBooks Online

Strong understanding of bookkeeping, reconciliations, and financial workflows

Detail-oriented with strong accuracy and organizational skills

Excellent written and verbal English communication

Confident and professional in executive communications

Comfortable working full-time EST hours

Looking for long-term stability and growth



Schedule & Location

Type: Full-Time, Dedicated

Hours: Monday through Friday, 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM EST



Location: Remote

Benefits & Compensation

13th Month Bonus

Paid Time Off (PTO)

title: E-Commerce Recruiter
description:
About the Role

We’re looking for an experienced E-commerce Recruiter with a strong track record of hiring for digital commerce businesses in the U.S.

In this role, you’ll lead the full recruitment lifecycle for e-commerce and digital roles — from sourcing and screening to interview coordination and offer close. You’ll work directly with founders, operators, and leadership teams to understand their hiring needs and deliver candidates who are both technically strong and commercially aligned.

This role is ideal for someone who understands the e-commerce ecosystem, thrives in a fast-moving environment, and knows how to identify and engage high-quality talent across commercial, marketing, operational, and technical functions.



Core Responsibilities



Source, screen, and recruit e-commerce professionals for U.S.-based companies.

Strong communication and relationship-building skills with both candidates and hiring stakeholders.

Nice-to-Haves



Experience recruiting remote e-commerce talent in LATAM or the Philippines.

Familiarity with independent contractor hiring models and compliance considerations.

Experience working with DTC brands, marketplaces (Amazon, Shopify, Walmart), or omnichannel businesses.

Background in high-growth companies, startups, or performance-driven environments.

title: Part-Time Virtual Assistant
description:
Part-Time Virtual Assistant (Operations, Research & Systems)

Remote | 10–15 Hours per Week | March Start



I run a growing creative studio and I’m looking for a highly organized, intelligent Virtual Assistant to help streamline business and personal operations.

You will help reduce chaos, build systems, and keep projects moving efficiently.

March 1

$300 USD

10–15 hours per week

Performance review at the end of March

Payment sent within 14 days of completed monthly work



Long-term growth and pay increases available for strong performance.



---



Core Responsibilities:

s and DMs

---

 what matters most

title: Senior PPC Specialist (Google & Meta Ads) - Australian Digital Agency
description:
Company: Australian Digital Agency

Role Level: Senior Specialist (High Execution / Technical Lead) Department: Performance Marketing (SEM & Social)

Reports To: Department Lead

Start Date: February 2026

Pay: Weekly pay US$500



** Role Overview **

We are looking for a Senior PPC Specialist to serve as the "engine room" for our paid media campaigns. You will be a hybrid marketer capable of driving performance across both

Google Ads (SEM) and Meta Ads 
/Instagram).



In this role, you will partner closely with an Account Manager. While the Account Manager holds the primary client relationship, you will be the technical voice in the room - executing the work, analysing the data, and joining calls to explain how we are achieving results.



Core Responsibilities

1. Google Ads (SEM) Execution

- Campaign Management: Set up and configure search campaigns with granular control. You own the day-to-day levers: bids, budgets, and keywords

- Optimisation: Manage bidding strategies independently to hit ROAS/CPA targets

- Search Quality: Perform deep keyword mining, negative keyword research, and Search Query Report (SQR) analysis

- Ad Copy: Write compelling headlines and descriptions; implement ad extensions (Sitelinks, Callouts) that align with the strategy set by the Account Manager



2. Meta Ads (Social) Execution

- Build & Launch: Build robust campaign structures from scratch, selecting objectives (Sales, Leads, Traffic) that align with the broader marketing goals

- Audience Strategy: Execute deep audience research, creating custom audiences, lookalikes, and interest stacks

- Creative Feedback: Analyse creative performance and provide specific, data-backed feedback to the design team (e.g., "The video hook is working, but the CTA needs to change")

- Testing: Manage rigorous A/B testing of creatives and audiences to drive incremental lift



3. Analytics & Diagnostics (No Implementation Required)

- Diagnosis over Deployment: You are not expected to write code or implement tags. However, you must be able to diagnose issues. You should be able to look at an account and flag if the Pixel isn't firing correctly or if GA4 data looks discrepant

- Data Analysis: Use GA4 and platform data to uncover trends. You will answer the question "Why is performance up/down?" using data, not just intuition

- Reporting: Compile data for weekly and monthly reports, providing the technical commentary that the Account Manager will present to the client



4. Client Support & Communication

- Technical Expert: You will join client calls as the Subject Matter Expert. While the Account Manager leads the meeting, you will speak to the technical performance, campaign logic, and optimisation details

- Response Support: Assist the Account Manager by drafting technical answers to complex client queries regarding attribution, bidding logic, or platform changes



Day-to-Day Tasks

Based on our internal task matrix, your focus will be on "High" and "Medium" brainpower tasks:

- Strategic Work: Competitor research, Funnel Strategy planning, and Targeting Strategy

- Optimisation: Bid strategy management, Quality Score analysis, and Budget pacing

- Creative Strategy: Briefing ad creative variations and writing ad copy

- Troubleshooting: Identifying 404s in ads or broken tracking links and flagging them for the dev team



** Requirements & Proficiency **

- Experience: 3-5+ years managing both Google Ads and Paid Social budgets

- Platform Mastery: Expert-level knowledge of Google Ads Manager, Google Ads Editor, and Meta Ads Manager

- Analytical Capability: Strong proficiency in reading GA4 and using it to cross-reference platform data. (Coding/GTM Implementation skills are not required, but the ability to identify a broken setup is).

- Communication: Articulate and clear. You can explain complex bidding algorithms to a non-technical client when called upon

- Autonomy: You can manage your own workload and task list without the Account Manager needing to micromanage your daily schedule



Bonus Points (Optional but Awesome)

- Automation: The ability to build automations to handle repetitive tasks would be a massive advantage

- Examples: Using Zapier/Make to connect lead forms to spreadsheets, writing Google Ads Scripts to automate budget pacing or negative keyword checks, or using AI tools to streamline reporting workflows.



** Ideal Candidate Profile **

You are a "Doer" who loves being inside the ad platforms. You prefer focusing on the craft of media buying - tweaking bids, testing audiences, and analysing results-rather than managing client contracts or handling high-level crisis management. You want to be the trusted technical partner to a strong Account Manager.

title: Broadcast Support Specialist - Work From Home
description:
BROADCAST SUPPORT SPECIALIST

Remote Work | No Experience Required 



We're building a team to support digital content creators. If you're tech-savvy and enjoy helping people, this could be your opportunity!





THE OPPORTUNITY



Content creators need technical support to focus on what they do best - creating. 

That's where you come in.

- Manage viewer chat environments  

- Solve technical issues quickly

- Report performance analytics



Why this matters: Great technical support = better content = happier audiences = creator success





WHO SHOULD APPLY



Requirements:

- Between 18-30 years old, male

- Can communicate in English (doesn't need to be perfect)

- Comfortable using computers and learning new software

- Have your own PC/laptop with good specs (details below)

- Can work full-time hours



Bonus points if you:

- Watch streams on Twitch, YouTube,
 Gaming, etc.

- Play online games or hang out in gaming communities

- Have experience with 
, Reddit, or online forums

- Enjoy problem-solving and helping people



Never had experience in broadcasts? No problem - we're looking for the right attitude and aptitude, not experience.





SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS



You'll need a decent PC because professional software (like OBS) uses a lot of resources. Here's the minimum specs that work well:



Processor (CPU):

- Intel: i
, i
, i
, i
K (or any newer/faster i5, i7, i9)

- AMD: Ryzen 5 1600, Ryzen 5 3600, Ryzen 5 5600 (or any newer/faster Ryzen)



Graphics Card (GPU):  

- NVIDIA: GTX 1060 (6GB), GTX 1660, RTX 2060 (or better - RTX 3060, 4060, etc.)

- AMD: RX 5600, RX 6600 (or better - RX 7600, etc.)



Other stuff:

- Fast internet (At least 100+ Mbps stable connection)

- Windows 10 or 11



If you have a gaming PC or built your own computer, you're probably good to go!





COMPENSATION



Starting Salary: $600-$780/month

- Weekly payments directly to your bank account

- Training period (4-5 days)

- Full salary from day one - no probation period discounts



Career Growth:

As you gain experience and take on more responsibilities, your compensation grows accordingly. Senior operators and team coordinators earn significantly more, with clear advancement paths based on performance.



Schedule:

- 4-6 hours per day, 5 days per week

- Flexible shift (morning/afternoon/evening/night)

- Additional compensation for overnight shifts





TRAINING & CAREER GROWTH



What happens after you're hired:



Week 1: Training

- Learn software basics

- Practice moderating chats

- Understand quality standards

- Get assigned a mentor who guides you



Week 2-3: Probation (paid everyday)

- Start working with our real clients

- Your mentor checks in regularly

- Build your confidence



Month 2+: Regular work

- You're fully independent

- Opportunities to advance

- Path to senior roles or team management



Average time to promotion: 6-8 months 





READY TO APPLY?



Send us a message with these details:



1. Your name, age

2. Your PC's processor (check System > About if you're not sure)

3. Your graphics card

4. How much RAM you have

5. Your internet speed (you can test it on speedtest or similar website)



That's all we need to get started! 

We review applications daily and respond within 1-2 business days.



IMPORTANT: We NEVER ask for money for training, equipment, or anything else. If someone asks you to pay, it's a scam.

title: Real Estate Investor Accountant Flips, Rehabs, Rentals
description:
Real Estate Investor Accountant (QBO Expert | Flips, Rehabs, Rentals)



The Job

We serve US-based real estate investors — flippers, landlords, and wholesalers. You will manage the books for multiple clients at the same time. You need to be fast, accurate, and work independently. If you need someone to tell you what to do every day, do not apply.



What You Will Do

• Keep books clean for multiple US real estate investor clients at the same time

• Track rehab budgets and project costs using QBO Projects and Classes

• Record purchases, sales, refinances, and loans correctly

• Reconcile hard money loans, private money, and lender payoffs

• Track all costs per property — purchase, rehab, carrying, and selling costs

• Reconcile bank accounts and credit cards monthly

• Prepare monthly P&L by property, Balance Sheet, and Cash Flow reports

• Catch book problems before the client does



Requirements

• 2+ years in a USA accounting/bookkeeping firm with REI clients doing flips, rehabs, refinances, rentals, and wholesales

• 3+ years using QBO — Projects, Classes, Locations, Job Costing, Rules, Reconciliations — no looking things up

• Managed multiple client books at the same time, not just one

• Can read and record a HUD-1 / ALTA closing disclosure correctly

• Understands BRRRR, fix-and-flip accounting, hard money loans, HELOCs

• Knows LLC and intercompany transactions across multiple entities

• Does month-end close independently

• Strong written English — you will talk directly to US clients

• Available AT LEAST 9PM–1AM PH time, Monday–Friday. No exceptions.



Do Not Apply If:

• You watch 
/incomedigs but never applied any of it with a real client

• Your only experience is property management (Yardi, Buildium, AppFolio) — never handled flips or rehab cost tracking in QBO

• You cannot work graveyard shift



How to Apply (USE 4AP or more)

Upload to Google Drive and share the link.

**Old files will be ignored. All files must be NEW.**

1. Latest resume

2. Short Loom video — introduce yourself and why you are perfect for this role.

3. Subject Line: Your Full Name | REI Bookkeeper Knows Rehab

title: Video Editor
description:
Video Editor, Social Media



Full-time | Remote / London



About AcademiaOne

AcademiaOne is a UK-based education technology company specialising in PhD applications and advanced academic pathways. We help ambitious individuals access world-class education and develop into future leaders in academia, research, and industry. Co-founded by a woman entrepreneur, we are a values-driven team operating across the UK, US, and Asia, combining modern digital systems with a globally connected, intellectually serious working culture.



We actively champion women's leadership and professional development, while fostering an inclusive environment where everyone, regardless of background or gender, is supported, valued, and given the opportunity to thrive.



We are not interested in short-term hires or disposable roles. We are building something long-term and we want to do it with exceptional people. If you are talented and committed, we will invest in your growth, reward your performance, and give you a real career path, not just a gig that ends when the project does.



About the Role

We are looking for a talented Video Editor to join our team and take full ownership of our social media content. You will be primarily editing Instagram videos, including Reels, Stories, and feed content, as well as supporting any additional video and creative needs as they come up.



We want someone who is genuinely passionate about video editing and social media, not just someone looking for the next job. If you love creating content, get excited about trends, and care about the quality of your work, we want to hear from you.



What You'll Be Doing



- Editing engaging, on-brand video content for Instagram and other social platforms

- Keeping up with social media trends, formats, and best practices

- Working closely with the marketing and content teams to bring ideas to life

- Supporting additional editing and creative projects as needed



What We're Looking For



- A genuine passion for video editing and social media content creation

- Proven experience editing short-form social media video content

- Strong eye for pacing, storytelling, and visual aesthetics

- Proficiency in editing software (e.g., Premiere Pro, Final Cut, CapCut, or similar)

- Ability to work independently, manage deadlines, and take creative ownership

- Bonus: experience with motion graphics, animation, or sound design



Why Join Us



- Long-term career growth, we invest in people who invest in us

- Positive culture built on trust, loyalty, and high standards

- Woman-led management with a genuine commitment to supporting women

- High ownership, your ideas and contributions truly matter

- Working with cutting-edge AI technology to shape the future of EdTech

- A mission that matters: widening access to world-class education

title: Frontend Developer (React/TypeScript) – Remote SaaS Product
description:
Join a funded AI SaaS startup building enterprise-grade dashboard software used by hotel management teams worldwide.



About Where to know (WTK)

Where to know is an AI-powered reputation and operational intelligence platform built for the global hotel industry. We transform data from OTA platforms (
, Expedia), Google, Tripadvisor, and social media into structured, actionable insights that help hotels improve operations and revenue.



About the Role

We are looking for a Frontend Developer to build and improve WTK's core enterprise dashboard product — used daily by hotel management teams to make real operational decisions.

This is NOT a marketing website or WordPress role.

This is a complex B2B SaaS dashboard involving:



Multi-hotel data architecture and role-based permissions

Large datasets with advanced filtering and sorting

AI-powered modules (AI Reply, sentiment analysis)

Reporting and competitor benchmarking dashboards

Data visualization with charts and tables



We value clean code, engineering quality, and long-term maintainability.



What You'll Do



Develop and continuously improve WTK's web frontend — Dashboard, Reports, AI Reply, Competitor Analysis modules

Translate Figma designs into production-ready enterprise interfaces with attention to information hierarchy, responsiveness, and consistency

Collaborate with backend, data, product, and design teams for API integration and complex state management

Build reusable components: component library, table/filtering systems, chart abstractions, theme system, i18n

Optimize rendering performance, first-load speed, and error monitoring

Participate in architecture decisions, code reviews, and documentation





Requirements (Must Have)



3+ years of frontend development experience

Strong HTML, CSS, JavaScript fundamentals

Proficient in TypeScript

Solid experience with React (Vue is also acceptable)

Understanding of component architecture, hooks, state management, and performance optimization

Experience building data-heavy interfaces: complex tables, filtering, dashboards, or admin panels

Familiar with Git and collaborative development workflows

Strong remote work habits: self-driven, communicates proactively, delivers on time





Nice to Have



Data visualization experience (ECharts, Recharts, D3)

Experience building or customizing a design system (e.g., Ant Design)

Next.js / SSR experience

i18n and multi-language layout handling

Testing tools (Jest, Playwright, Cypress)

Monitoring tools (Sentry) and analytics tracking

Vite / Webpack, ESLint / Prettier, CI/CD experience

B2B SaaS or hospitality/travel industry background





What We Offer



Fully remote, results-driven culture — minimal unnecessary meetings

Your work directly impacts real hotel operations and business outcomes

Fast feedback loop from actual users

Flat team structure with short decision chains

Ownership encouraged — we value engineers who care about quality

Compensation: Base salary + performance/project incentive (negotiable)





How to Apply

Please include in your application:



Your resume

GitHub or portfolio (if available)

2–3 representative projects — briefly describe a complex table, dashboard, or data-heavy feature you built and the tech stack you used

Describe one performance bottleneck you encountered in a data-heavy UI and how you solved it. 

or

Describe a specific table or list component you built that handled 1000+ rows. What was the performance issue and what technique did you use to solve it?

Your expected monthly salary (USD)

Your available hours per week

Your earliest start date

At the top of your application, write the word “DashboardReady” so we know you read the full job description.



Applications without project examples will not be prioritized.

title: Zapier Automation Engineer for Typeform to Phorest CRM Workflow
description:
I run a UK based hair salon. We have built an online Typeform quiz that gives clients a personalised hair quote. The backend is currently messy and unreliable.



I need an experienced automation developer to rebuild and clean up the workflow properly.



The system must:

 1. Trigger from Typeform submission

 2. Calculate a correct from price based on fixed pricing rules

 3. Generate a short summary of the client responses under 250 characters

 4. Send the lead into Phorest CRM via API or Lead Magnet correctly

 5. Send a personalised quote
 containing the calculated from price

 6. Ensure no duplicate leads are created

 7. Log errors and notify me if something fails



This needs to be structured cleanly and documented so it is reliable and scalable.



You must:

• Be experienced with Zapier

• Understand webhooks and REST APIs

• Have worked with CRM integrations

• Provide clear logic documentation

• Build this in a clean and maintainable way



This is not a beginner task. Please explain how you would structure this before I hire you.



Please give me an idea of timeframe for completing this work.

title: Ai automation specialist
description:
We need an Automation Builder VA to deploy and manage multiple AI receptionist / patient-intake automations for different medical clinics. Each clinic may have different rules (HIPAA needs, scheduling preferences, intake process), so the VA must be able to clone a base system, customize it per clinic, test it, and document it.



Core deliverables per clinic



Clinic discovery + config sheet: hours, services, FAQs, insurance rules, escalation rules, “do/don’t say,” emergency disclaimers.



Phone + SMS setup: provision numbers, call routing, voi
/missed-call handling, confirmation/follow-up texts.



Conversation flow build: greet ? identify intent ? answer FAQs ? collect patient details ? route/transfer or send intake link ? confirm next steps.



Integrations: connect to the clinic’s tools (or avoid them if required)—EHR/CRM intake, form capture, ticket creation, staff notifications.



Logging + reporting: track calls, outcomes, lead/patient info captured, and basic ROI metrics (calls handled, appointments requested, staff time saved).



Testing + QA: test scripts, edge cases, failures; verify escalation works; ensure compliance constraints are followed.



SOPs: “how it works,” “how to update FAQs,” troubleshooting steps, and a handoff guide for clinic staff.



Must-have skills



Building workflows in n8n / Zapier / Make + using webhooks/APIs



Telephony & SMS setup (Twilio or similar)



Debugging + reliability mindset (monitoring, fallbacks, error handling)



Strong documentation (repeatable deployments)

Job Title: Staffing Representative - Home Health Therapy (Remote, Night Shift)



Location: Work from Home - (U.S. Pacific Standard Time)



About the Company

A List Therapy Group is a California-based provider of in-home physical, occupational, and speech therapy services. We partner with over 300 agencies and hospitals, delivering exceptional patient care through our large network of licensed therapists.



Position Overview

We are hiring a full-time Staffing Representative to work remotely. This role coordinates therapist assignments, manages incoming referrals, updates patient records, and ensures fast, accurate communication with both clinicians and U.S.-based partner agencies. You will also be responsible for problem-solving staffing challenges and maintaining strong professional relationships with our therapists.



Key Duties



• Review and respond to incoming patient referrals in real time.

• Assign therapists based on location, coverage area, and specialty.

• Enter and update patient data in CliniConnects and TherapySync.

• Follow up on pending cases and manage restaffing when needed.

• Send consent forms and required documents to therapists.

• Communicate promptly via WhatsApp, phone, and
.

• Maintain positive working relationships with therapists to encourage engagement and reliability.

• Identify and resolve staffing issues quickly to prevent delays in patient care.

• Maintain accurate records and update rate sheets as needed.



Qualifications



• Experience in home health staffing, healthcare scheduling, or medical coordination preferred.

• Strong English communication skills (written and spoken).

• Proven problem-solving abilities and conflict resolution skills.

• Ability to build and maintain professional relationships with therapists.

• Highly organized, able to multitask, and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

• Proficiency with Google Workspace, WhatsApp, and data entry systems.

• Own computer, noise-cancelling headset, and stable internet connection.

• Comfortable using Hubstaff and 
 with a working camera.

• Willing to work night shift: Monday–Friday, 9:00 AM–6:00 PM PST (Philippines time: 12:00 AM–9:00 AM).



Why Join Us



• Competitive pay for remote work.

• Work directly with a U.S.-based healthcare company.

• Supportive, team-focused environment with growth opportunities.



How to Apply



• Please send a short cover letter highlighting your experience relevant to the role you are applying for, and include your answers to the questions below:

     1. How many years of experience do you have working for a home health provider company?

title: Wordpress Web Developer
description:
We are looking for a full-time web developer. If you love to build web sites and web applications, and you're passionate about the sanctity of human life, this is the position you've been looking for!You should have a desire to work behind the scenes with your team to get things done. You like to see a large project through from start to finish. You’re great under pressure and thrive working on tight deadlines. The ideal Web Developer for this position has worked extensively with WordPress theming, templates and custom plugins. He/she has also built and maintained websites using WordPress, Code Igniter, and Laravel. Our themes are custom built with the Roots Sage WordPress starter theme that utilizes PHP/Blade, SCSS, JavaScript and utilizes Yarn to compile assets. If you are someone who can dive into both the front end composition of these themes as well as setup and troubleshoot the backend of the theme with the support of your team, this is the position for you.Our ideal candidate takes pride in their ability to communicate with others. They not only can explain a technical issue or function in a way that someone who isn’t a developer can digest, but enjoy the opportunity to have those teaching 
nts. They have a knack for learning new technology and wanting to grow as a developer. They also recognize the importance of asking for help and having code reviews, both to help yourself and others on the team.Lastly, we also build custom plugins to solve problems for our clients. A strong knowledge of WordPress plugin architecture, MySQL and how WordPress organizes data is preferred.



Industries We Work With:

* Pregnancy Help Centers & other pro-life organizations

* Local brands, including construction, retail, healthcare, non-profits & more

* Professional and trade associations



Responsibilities:

* Three years' experience with PHP

* Four years' experience with WordPress

* Website Optimization - you know how to keep website performance ranked high on Google Lighthouse

* Knowledge of MVC

* Experience with Git on the command line

* MySQL

* SCSS

* JQuery

*
 Bootstrap

* Blade Templating



Nice to Have:

* Experience with Code Igniter

* Experience with Laravel

* Experience with Vue.js

* Experience with build systems, specifically Gulp and Yarn

* Server/website hosting knowledge including:

* SSL management

* Website updates/maintenance (WordPress updates and troubleshooting hacked sites)

* Launching websites and transferring sites to and from a server

* Have proof of work (Work Samples)



The Ideal candidate:

* Has a general understanding of domain management and DNS

* Excels at open communication about projects

* Happy to support by making minor edits to content (widgets/menus/pages/posts/etc.) within WordPress

* Likes to push their sleeves up to find a needle in a haystack

* Ability to follow processes when troubleshooting website issues

* Will know when to check the error logs and when to check the Git repos for uncommitted changes



Experience:

* WordPress development: 3 years (Preferred)

* PHP: 5 years (Preferred)

* [removed] 5 years (Preferred)

* Laravel: 2 years (Preferred)

* Code Igniter: 2 years (Preferred)





To fast track your application, please submit the following information:

Resume: A link to your Google Drive. Please ensure the sharing setting is set to "Anyone with the link."



IMPORTANT REMINDER: To advance in the screening process, you must submit the Podio Form. Timely completion is essential to guarantee your application receives prompt attention.

title: Sales Operations & Appointment Setter (B2B)
description:
About the Role:

We are a high-ticket B2B sales agency specializing in $7,500+ offers with 10–14 day sales cycles. We are looking for a dedicated Sales Development Representative based in the Philippines to own the front-end of our sales funnel. This is not a general VA role; you will be responsible for identifying high-volume B2B leads, executing outbound outreach, and managing a rigorous follow-up system.



Key Responsibilities:

Lead Identification: Use tools like 
, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, and Meta Ad Library to find B2B companies (Coaching, SaaS, DFY Agencies) with high-ticket offers and active ad spend.



Outbound Outreach: Execute multi-channel outreach (LinkedIn,
, and DM) to engage CEOs and Founders.



Appointment Setting: Qualify prospects based on specific revenue and sales cycle criteria before booking them onto the Head Closer’s calendar.



CRM Hygiene: Maintain 100?curacy in our CRM, ensuring every lead is tracked and no follow-up is missed.



Speed-to-Lead: Monitor inbound inquiries and respond within a 5–10 minute window during active shift hours.



Technical Requirements:

Sales Tech Stack: Proven experience using CRMs (GoHighLevel, HubSpot, or Pipedrive) and cold outreach tools (Instantly, Lemlist, or Salesloft).



English Proficiency: High-level professional written and verbal English. You must be able to communicate naturally with Western business owners.



B2B Experience: Minimum 1–2 years of experience specifically in B2B lead generation or appointment setting.



Data Literacy: Ability to build and clean lead lists, ensuring high deliverability and low bounce rates.



Behavioral Traits:

The "Hunter" Mindset: You are driven by hitting booking targets and understand that the "fortune is in the follow-up."



Direct Communication: You can take feedback and implement strategy shifts immediately.



Reliability: You are available to work [Insert Your Timezone] hours to align with our target market.



What We Offer:

Opportunity to work at the founding level of a high-ticket agency.



Performance-based bonuses for every qualified meeting booked and every deal closed.



Ongoing training in high-level B2B sales strategy.

title: HR Executive Assistant to Spa CEO USA
description:
**Location:** Remote www.cloud9.spa

**Employment Type:** Full-Time

Must be dedicated, cannot accept other side jobs or projects, otherwise, please do not apply.



About Us:

We are a rapidly growing chain of family-friendly spas committed to exceptional client experience, employee development, and operational excellence. As we continue to expand, we are seeking a highly experienced and proactive HR Specialist & Executive Assistant to the CEO to support high-level strategic initiatives and drive team success across our multi-location business.



---



### Key Responsibilities



**HR & Team Development** - PRIORITY FOCUS



* Recruit front desk receptionist and spa manager for all locations across the US.

* Assist the CEO in developing and implementing a manager training program tailored for the spa industry.

* Conduct monthly one-on-one meetings with front desk staff and managers to promote professional growth and address operational concerns.

* Review and enhance career development tracks for receptionists and managers.

* Lead quarterly performance reviews for all front desk staff and managers.

* Collaborate in project performance reviews, including tracking milestones and outcomes.



**Strategic Communications & Project Management**



* Communicate major project announcements, updates, and evaluations on behalf of the CEO.

* Support project execution and help ensure follow-through and accountability across departments.

* Manage and enhance online reputation by reviewing customer feedback, drafting responses, and proposing service resolutions.



**Executive Support**



* Manage the CEO’s calendar, travel, and strategic planning needs.

* Conduct business research to support decision-making and strategic initiatives.

* Assist in evaluating completed projects, including effectiveness, team performance, and client impact.

* Provide assistance on special projects and operational improvements across the organization.



---



### Qualifications



* 5–10 years of HR experience in an American business environment, preferably in multi-location operations.

* Proven experience in developing managers, leading teams, and implementing performance management systems.

* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills; must be articulate, persuasive, and detail-oriented.

* Strong project management and organizational abilities.

* Demonstrated success in managing by objectives and driving results.

* High level of discretion, emotional intelligence, and ability to handle confidential information.

* Background in wellness, hospitality, or service-based industries is a plus.



---



What We Offer



* Opportunity to work closely with executive leadership

* Collaborative and mission-driven team environment

* Growth potential in a fast-scaling company



---



How to Apply:

Please submit your resume, a brief cover letter, a self intro video, and some project summaries demonstrating your ability to communicate effectively and manage complex initiatives.

title: High-Ticket B2B Sales Closer ($7,500+ Offers)
description:
Role Overview:

We are a specialized Sales Agency scaling B2B offers (Coaching, SaaS, and DFY Agencies) with average deal sizes of $7,500+ and aggressive 10–14 day sales cycles. We are looking for a world-class High-Ticket Sales Closer based in the Philippines to join our team.



This is not a "customer service" or "order taker" role. You will be closing sophisticated B2B decision-makers (Founders/CEOs) who expect high-level consultancy and professional persistence.



Key Responsibilities:

Inbound Closing: Conduct high-pressure sales calls via Zoom with pre-qualified B2B prospects.



Pipeline Mastery: Manage a high volume of meetings (20–30+ per week) with a focus on "One-Call" or "Two-Call" closes.



Follow-Up Excellence: Execute a rigorous 14-day follow-up sequence for any prospect who doesn't close on the first call.



CRM Management: Maintain 100?curacy in CRM data (GoHighLevel/HubSpot), including detailed call notes and revenue tracking.



Daily Reporting: Participate in daily sales scrums to review objections, win rates, and pipeline health.



Requirements:

Fluency: Exceptional, near-native English verbal communication skills. You must be able to lead a conversation, not just follow a script.



B2B Experience: Minimum 2+ years of experience closing deals with a minimum $5,000 price point.



Framework Knowledge: Familiarity with NEPQ, Straight Line, or similar consultative sales frameworks.



Environment: A professional, quiet home office setup with high-speed internet and a high-quality camera/microphone for Zoom calls.



Availability: Ability to work [Insert Timezone, e.g., EST or PST] hours to align with US/European business owners.



Mandatory Application Step:

To be considered for this role, you MUST submit a 2-3 minute video recording (Loom or similar) with your application. In this video, please:



Briefly introduce your sales background and your largest B2B close to date.



Explain your philosophy on handling the "I need to think about it" objection in a 14-day sales cycle.



Demonstrate your communication style—we are looking for confidence, tonality, and authority.



Applications without a video will be automatically disqualified.



What We Offer:

High-volume, pre-qualified lead flow (no cold calling).



Uncapped commission structure with high earning potential on $7,500+ deals.



Direct mentorship and sales training to sharpen your closing skills.

title: Senior Full Stack Developer - 10+ years of experience
description:
We're looking for a Senior Full Stack Developer who's passionate about building exceptional web applications and solving real-world problems for growing businesses. This is your chance to be part of a fast-moving team that values technical excellence, collaboration, and making an impact.



If you're highly skilled in React, Next.js, Nest.js, and Node.js, hold an AWS certification, and are comfortable working US business hours, we'd love to meet you.



Key Responsibilities



Lead the design, development, and deployment of high-performance web applications on AWS infrastructure.

Work across the stack using React, Next.js, Nest.js, and Node.js to build scalable, maintainable features.

Collaborate with product managers, designers, and fellow engineers to ship high-quality solutions.

Own development cycles from concept to deployment—including testing, documentation, and performance optimization.

Implement and maintain robust, well-tested APIs and backend services.

Contribute to architectural decisions and help mentor junior developers as needed.



Requirements



Minimum of 10+ years of hands-on experience as a Full Stack Developer.

Active AWS Certification required (Cloud Practitioner or any foundational-level certification at minimum). Candidates are expected to pursue Associate or Professional-level certifications after joining.

Hands-on experience with AWS services (e.g., Lambda, S3, API Gateway, EC2) in production environments.

Expertise with React, Next.js, Nest.js, and Node.js in production environments.

Proficiency with REST APIs, modern JavaScript/TypeScript, and async programming.

Strong experience with Git and collaborative workflows (e.g., GitHub, GitLab).

Excellent debugging, optimization, and problem-solving skills.

Clear written and verbal communication.

Availability to work full-time during US business hours.



Preferred Qualifications



AWS Associate or Professional-level certification (Solutions Architect, Developer, or DevOps Engineer).

Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines, DevOps practices, and infrastructure as code.

Experience with serverless architectures and performance-focused applications.



What We Offer



Competitive compensation (DOE).

Flexible, remote-friendly role aligned with US time zones.

Opportunities for continuous learning, mentorship, and career growth—including support for AWS certification advancement.

A supportive, collaborative team culture that values quality and innovation.

The chance to work on meaningful projects that drive real business value.



If you're a seasoned developer ready to take ownership and grow with a team that values your expertise—apply now and let's build something great together.

title: Marketing Leader
description:
Marketing Leader



This is a leadership seat for someone who wants ownership, speed, authority, and a scoreboard. You’ll build and run a marketing machine that produces qualified demand, strengthens brand dominance, and runs on repeatable systems—not vibes, not committees.



You’ll win through others—aligning Intake, Digital Media, Paid Marketing, Community Outreach, and Client Success around clear priorities, fast follow-through, and shared KPIs.



Mandatory Assessment to Apply: 



Work Setup + Schedule (Non-Negotiable)

• Full-time, remote (Philippines-based)

• Must work synchronous with our U.S. Central Time (CT/CST) office hours:

– Monday–Friday, 8:30 AM – 5:30 PM CT

– You’re expected to be available in real time for meetings, collaboration, and same-day execution during these hours.



What you own (the scoreboard)

• Qualified demand (calls/leads/appointments that convert)

• Efficiency + ROI discipline (spend moves with performance)

• Brand strength in our market (attention + trust)

• A repeatable system (cadence, campaigns, reporting, improvement loops)

What you’ll do

• Set strategy, then drive execution (plans, deadlines, deliverables, owners)

• Run a weekly KPI cadence with actions tied to numbers

• Cut what’s not working and reallocate fast

• Build standards, checklists, and playbooks that enforce performance and consistency

• Lead a small team with tight follow-through and high expectations



You’re a fit if you…

• Take ownership naturally and hate drift

• Prefer autonomy and accountability over consensus

• Think in systems, pipelines, scoreboards, and iteration

• Move fast, communicate directly, and bring solutions

• Want a role where change is normal and performance is rewarded



This will frustrate you if you…

• Need constant assurance to move

• Avoid metrics or accountability

• Prefer slow pace, hand holding, or “marketing as creativity only”



Compensation

• Base Pay: $2,000–$3,500/month (experience-based)

• Performance-based upside tied to marketing results

• Seat on the EOS Leadership Team (participation during CT hours)



Why This Role Matters

This is a key hire to unlock the firm’s next level of growth. With the right person, it enables the Founder to step fully into the Visionary seat while the business runs faster, stronger, and more predictably.



How to Apply

• Mandatory Assessment to Apply: 

• Include Resume

title: YouTube Growth Lead
description:
Role Overview:

We are hiring a YouTube Growth Lead to own YouTube ideation, scripting refinement, and content launches with the goal of consistently reaching 50K+ views per video.

This role is not just about ideas — it’s about engineering growth.

You will take first-pass scripts and transform them into high-retention, high-conversion content. You will lead creative direction, bring scalable thumbnail concepts, and manage execution across the content lifecycle.

This is a strategic and leadership-level creative role.



Key Responsibilities:

1. YouTube Growth Strategy

• Develop scalable video concepts designed to reach 50K+ views

• Identify trends, hooks, and positioning angles aligned with the brand

• Own content launch strategy and performance optimization

2. Script Development

• Refine first-pass scripts into filming-ready drafts

•  Improve hooks, retention structure, and storytelling flow

• Ensure clarity, authority, and audience engagement

3. Creative Direction

• Lead thumbnail concept ideation that drives CTR

• Oversee title strategy and packaging

• Direct the creative execution team (editor, designer, etc.) 

• Lead the video editing process by guiding editors, giving specific feedback on cuts, pacing, storytelling, and ensuring the final videos meet content strategy, creative direction, and brand standards

4. Performance Optimization

• Analyze YouTube performance data

• Identify retention drop-offs and improvement opportunities

• Continuously test hooks, titles, and formats

5. Systems & Workflow

• Streamline the YouTube production system inside Notion

• Collaborate via Slack (fast-paced communication)

• Provide feedback via Loom/video updates



Qualifications:

• Proven YouTube growth experience (ideally creator-led channels)

• Strong scripting and storytelling skills

• Deep understanding of retention, hooks, and thumbnail psychology

• Comfortable working in a fast-paced, flexible environment

• Experience managing creative contributors

• Strong grasp of YouTube analytics



Tools:

• YouTube Studio

• Notion

• Slack

• Loom



What Success Looks Like (First 30 Days):

• You streamline the YouTube workflow

• You elevate script drafts to filming-ready quality

• You present scalable thumbnail systems

• Early videos show improved retention and CTR

• Clear roadmap toward consistent 50K+ view performance



Details:

• 10–20 hours per week

• Flexible working hours

• CET overlap preferred

• Paid test project



Paid Test Process:

All shortlisted candidates will complete a paid test.

Test may include:

• Rewriting the intro of a real first-pass script (script provided)

• Pitching 5 title/thumbnail ideas aimed at ~50K views

• Editing a short-form video (video provided)

Compensation will be provided for completed test work.



Application Process:

To apply, please submit the following:

• Your updated resume

• A portfolio showcasing relevant work

• A 2–3 minute Loom video highlighting your experience relevant to the role

title: Amazon Inventory Manager
description:
Role Overview



The Amazon Inventory Manager is responsible for ensuring brands never go out of stock, never overstock unnecessarily, and always have clean, proactive forecasting in place.



This role directly protects revenue.



You will work closely with Account Managers, Ads Managers, and brand partners to maintain healthy inventory levels and eliminate reactive fire drills.



Key Responsibilities

???? Shipment Creation & FBA Management

- Create and manage FBA shipments in Seller Central

- Coordinate shipment plans with brand partners

- Monitor inbound shipments and receiving discrepancies

- Ensure accurate SKU mapping and labeling requirements



???? Forecasting & Planning

- Build 30 / 60 / 90 day inventory forecasts

- Factor in seasonality, promotions, and ad scaling

- Identify reorder timing and production lead times

- Flag OOS risks early (minimum 4–6 weeks in advance)



???? Weekly Inventory Reporting

- Send weekly inventory health reports to all assigned brands

- Clearly communicate:

         - Days of cover

         - OOS risks

       -  Overstock risks

         - Recommended actions

         - Highlight SKUs needing immediate decisions

Brand Communication



Communicate directly with brand partners regarding:

- Reorder timelines

- Production delays

- Shipping updates

- Risk mitigation plans

- Maintain proactive, professional communication

- ???? Risk Management

- Monitor sell-through velocity changes

- Flag issues tied to ad scaling or demand spikes

- Coordinate with Ads + AM teams when spend adjustments are needed

- Prevent stockouts that impact revenue and ranking



What Success Looks Like

- Zero surprise stockouts

- Clear weekly reporting

- Proactive forecasting (not reactive scrambling)

- Strong communication with brands

- Organized Seller Central shipment management



Qualifications

- 2+ years Amazon FBA inventory management experience

- Deep knowledge of Seller Central shipment workflows

- Strong forecasting and analytical skills

- Comfortable working with spreadsheets (Excel or Google Sheets)

- Detail-oriented and process-driven

- Strong written communication skills

- Experience managing multiple brands simultaneously



Bonus Points

- Experience with forecasting tools

- Experience in high-growth Amazon brands

- Understanding of ad velocity impact on inventory



Who This Role Is For. This is for someone who:

- Thinks in systems

- Loves spreadsheets

- Hates surprises

- Takes ownership

- Communicates clearly

- Thrives in fast-paced environments



Why Join Flagship Growth

- High-growth agency environment

- Clear ownership and responsibility

- Direct impact on revenue

- Opportunity to grow into Senior Ops / Supply Chain roles

title: GoHighlevel Specialist for Advertising Agency
description:
We are seeking a GoHighlevel Specialist to help us optimize our marketing automation processes. The ideal candidate will have proven experience in utilizing GoHighlevel to enhance client acquisition and retention strategies. You will work closely with our marketing team to set up workflows, build landing pages, and integrate various marketing tools. Familiarity with CRM systems and the ability to analyze data for campaign performance is essential. If you are detail-oriented and have a passion for driving results through automation, we want to hear from you!



Key Responsibilities:



Workflow Automation:

• Design, test, and implement workflows to automate lead nurturing, appointment scheduling, and follow-up processes.

• Troubleshoot and optimize existing workflows for better performance and user experience.



CRM Management:

• Customize the GoHighLevel CRM to align with business goals.

• Ensure accurate lead and contact segmentation for targeted marketing campaigns.



Campaign Support:

• Create and manage
, SMS, and voi
 campaigns within GHL.

Integrations:

Client Portal Management:

Analytics and Reporting:

• Generate reports on workflow performance, lead conversions, and campaign ROI.

• Present data-driven insights to support decision-making.



Training and Support:

• Train tea
mbers on using GHL effectively.

• Provide ongoing support for troubleshooting and user queries.



Qualifications:



Experience:

• Proven experience using GoHighLevel (minimum 1 year preferred).

Skills:

title: Client Onboarding Specialist
description:

This role is mission-critical. You will be the first real human touchpoint after a client expresses interest — guiding them from inquiry to activation while delivering a premium onboarding experience.

Converting qualified prospects into paying clients



Managing the onboarding process from signup to activation



Providing high-level customer support during the early client lifecycle



Ensuring clients fully understand and utilize our systems



Setting expectations clearly and professionally



You are not just “answering calls.”

You are driving revenue and ensuring retention from day one.



Key Responsibilities



Sales & Conversion



Run structured sales calls with qualified leads



Identify client needs and position solutions effectively



Handle objections confidently



Close deals and collect payment details when applicable



Maintain accurate CRM records



Client Onboarding



Guide new clients through onboarding steps



Schedule and coordinate onboarding sessions



Ensure contracts, forms, and documents are completed



Confirm system access and setup



Customer Support



Respond to client inquiries via
, phone, and messaging



Troubleshoot basic issues or escalate when necessary



Maintain a professional, calm, and solution-oriented tone



Follow up consistently to ensure satisfaction



Qualifications



Fluent, professional-level English (spoken and written)



Strong sales call experience (closing experience preferred)



Excellent communication and active listening skills



Highly organized and detail-oriented



Comfortable using CRM and communication tools



Able to handle objections without becoming defensive



Self-motivated and performance-driven



What Success Looks Like



High conversion rates from scheduled calls



Smooth, frictionless onboarding experiences



Strong early-stage client retention



Positive client feedback



Accurate CRM and documentation management



Compensation



Base pay + performance incentives



Commission opportunities for closed deals



Growth path into senior account management or leadership



Who This Role Is NOT For

How to Apply

Your resume

title: Lead Generator
description:
About Gutter Guard PRO:

Gutter Guard PRO is a fast-growing exterior maintenance company operating across North America. We work with homeowners and property managers to provide gutter cleaning and gutter guard installation services that deliver long-term protection against water damage, foundation issues, and costly repairs.

We are expanding our commercial division and are looking for motivated Lead Generators to help introduce our services to property management companies and condominium corporations throughout Canada and the United States.



Position Overview:

- This role focuses on outbound cold calling to property management companies to introduce our annual gutter cleaning service and identify potential working relationships.

- You will not be closing sales. Your responsibility is to start conversations, build rapport, and gather contact information so our sales team can follow up.

- This is a professional B2B calling role. Strong communication skills and confidence on the phone are essential.



Responsibilities:

- Make outbound cold calls to property management companies and condominium corporations

- Introduce our services using a provided script (with flexibility to adapt naturally)

- Build rapport with decision-makers and gatekeepers

- Identify interest and gather accurate contact information

- Submit lead details through a Google Form after conversations

- Maintain consistent call activity throughout scheduled work hours

- Represent the company professionally on every call



Compensation:

- Hourly Pay: $3 to $5 USD per hour (based on experience)

- Bonus: $10 USD per qualified lead

- Paid training provided

- There is strong potential for performance-based raises and advancement opportunities. Top performers may be promoted into sales roles with significantly higher salaries.



Work Schedule:

- Full-Time: 40 hours per week

- Part-Time: 20 hours per week available

- Monday to Friday only

- 9:00 AM to 6:00 PM Eastern Time

- 1 hour unpaid break (flexible timing)

- North American holidays observed

- Flexible unpaid time off available with advance notice.



Requirements:

- Fluent English with strong verbal communication skills

- Confident and professional speaking voice

- Comfortable making cold calls for extended periods

- Reliable high-speed internet connection

- Quiet, noise-free workspace

- Quality headset with microphone

- Computer capable of running VoIP software

- Previous cold calling or sales experience is a plus but not required.



Tools Provided:

- Company calling system (RingCentral)

- Scripts and training materials

- Lead submission system

- Ongoing support and coaching



Who We Are Looking For:

- We are looking for individuals who:

- Are confident speaking with professionals

- Are not afraid of rejection

- Can stay motivated while making cold calls

- Have a positive and persistent mindset

- Want to grow into higher-level sales roles over time

- This role is ideal for someone who wants long-term stability and career growth in sales.



How to Apply (Important):

To be considered, you must complete all steps below:

- Submit your application through OnlineJobs.ph

- Attach a short video recording or audio recording to your application that includes you describing your sales or phone experience as well as reading the following script: “Hello, my name is [Your Name], and I’m calling from Gutter Guard PRO. We work with property management companies to provide annual gutter cleaning services for residential buildings and condominiums. I was hoping to speak with the person responsible for building maintenance to introduce our services and see if this might be helpful for your properties.”

-Applicants who do not submit a video will not be considered.



If you are motivated, reliable, and ready to grow with a North American company, we would love to hear from you. Feel free to check out our website for more information -

description:
We're Hiring: Remote Appointment Setter (Part
-Time)

Company Name: 

 Position: Remote Appointment Setter

 Compensation: $500/month Base pay + commission per qualified booking

 Location: 100% Remote

 Start Date: ASAP



About Us

Pierre helps driven individuals optimize their health, physique, and performance through structured training, nutrition, and genetic-based strategies. We’re growing fast and need a hungry, driven setter who’s ready to help us scale to the next level.



About the Role

You’ll be responsible for starting high-quality conversations in the DMs, qualifying prospects, and booking them into our sales calendar.

You’ll be working directly with Pierre and the sales team to help grow the business.



Responsibilities

Initiate 100–150 new DM conversations daily across Instagram,





Use our proven DM scripts and follow-up trackers (no cold calling!)





Qualify leads and book sales calls with ideal prospects

Track KPIs and performance daily

Coachable and hungry to improve

title: Top-Tier Virtual Assistant - MUST BE EXPERIENCED (Gmail, Social Media, WordPress, Shopify, Customer Support)
description:
We’re hiring a top-tier Virtual Assistant to help run day-to-day operations across Gmail inbox management, social media execution (Instagram,
, LinkedIn), basic WordPress website updates, Shopify product support, and customer service. This role requires someone who is already experienced—zero training. You must be organized, responsive, and able to execute tasks accurately and consistently.



This is not a “task taker” role. We need a proactive operator who can keep systems clean, content moving, customers supported, and communication tight—without repeated follow-ups.



Core Responsibilities (Tools You’ll Use Daily):

1) Gmail + Admin Operations

• Manage inbox (labels, filters, prioritization, follow-ups)

• Draft and send professional responses using brand voice

• Track action items and ensure nothing falls through the cracks

• Calendar scheduling, confirmations, reminders, and coordination



2) Social Media Execution (IG /
 / LinkedIn)

• Schedule and post content consistently (feed posts, stories as needed, LinkedIn posts)

• Write/format captions (or polish provided copy), apply hashtags, tag accounts, add links

• Monitor comments/DMs and respond appropriately (or escalate)

• Maintain a simple content calendar and organize assets



3) WordPress Website Maintenance

• Basic page updates: text, images, links, formatting, blog uploads

• Troubleshoot minor issues (broken links, layout formatting, mobile display checks)

• Keep site clean, updated, and aligned with current offers



4) Shopify Support (Books/Journals + Products)

• Upload/edit products (titles, descriptions, variants, pricing, images)

• Create discount codes, update collections, basic storefront updates

• Assist with customer order questions (shipping status, product access, common issues) 



5) Customer Service

• Respond to customer inquiries with professionalism and warmth

• Use templates where appropriate; escalate issues when needed

• Maintain high-quality experience and fast response times



What Success Looks Like:

• Inbox stays organized and responses are timely, clear, and on-brand

• Social media stays consistent (no missed posts, no sloppy formatting)

• WordPress site remains current, polished, and functional

• Shopify products and updates are accurate and clean

• Customers feel supported, and issues are resolved quickly

• You communicate proactively and manage priorities well



Required Skills (Non-Negotiable):

• Proven VA experience supporting businesses with Gmail + social media + customer service

• Hands-on experience with WordPress updates and Shopify product management

• Strong English communication (written and spoken)

• Detail-driven, highly organized, fast and accurate execution

• Reliable, responsive, and able to work independently

• Comfortable using Google Workspace and common social scheduling tools



Nice-to-Have (Bonus):

• Basic Canva (similar tools) skills for resizing graphics / simple edits

• Light copywriting and content calendar planning

• Familiarity with CRMs, automations, or online booking tools



How to Apply (REQUIRED):



Reply with:

1. A short summary of your experience with Gmail + IG/FB/LinkedIn + WordPress + Shopify

2. 2–3 examples of similar work (screenshots, portfolio, or short Loom walkthroughs)

3. Your availability (hours you can work) in Eastern Time

4. Your hourly rate and weekly hours available

5. Answer: What’s your system for managing inbox, social posting, and customer service without things falling through the cracks?

description:

You will work a few hours per day, Monday–Friday (Eastern Time). Hours are flexible and will be discussed, but during your scheduled window you must be present, responsive, and available in real time—no exceptions. This role has the potential to expand as project volume increases.

title: GrowthHub 365 All-in-One Marketing & CRM Specialist
description:
I'm looking for someone who's a GrowthHub 365 All-in-One Marketing & CRM Specialist to build, manage, and optimize our full client/customer journey inside GrowthHub 365—from website and funnel builds to CRM pipeline setup, automations,
/SMS campaigns, integrations, tracking, and reporting.



This role is for someone who can take ownership of the system and make it run like a machine: leads captured cleanly, follow-ups automated, appointments booked, and performance visible in dashboards. You’ll be responsible for both building and maintaining what you build—so we’re looking for an experienced operator, not someone learning the platform for the first time.



- What you’ll own in GrowthHub 365:

- Build/maintain websites, landing pages, funnels, and forms (mobile-first, conversion-focused)

- Set up and manage CRM pipelines, stages, tags, custom fields, segmentation, and lead source tracking

- Create and optimize automations/workflows (lead capture ? nurture ? booking ? reminders ? follow-up ? reactivation)

- Build and manage
 + SMS campaigns (nurture sequences, broadcasts, templates)

- Handle integrations (calendar,
, domains, forms, payment links, Zapier/webhooks if needed)

- Set up basic tracking and reporting so we can see weekly performance (leads, booked calls, show rates, conversions)

- Troubleshoot issues quickly (broken workflows, missed triggers, duplicates, deliverability hiccups)

- Document systems with short SOPs + Loom walkthroughs / etc



What success looks like: 

- A clean, organized GrowthHub 365 account with solid structure (folders, naming conventions, assets).

- Websites/funnels built fast and clean (mobile-first, conversion-focused).

- CRM pipeline set up correctly with stages + tagging + automation logic.

- Automations that actually work (lead capture ? nurture ? booking ? follow-up ? reactivation).

-
/SMS campaigns set up properly with good deliverability practices.

- Consistent lead tracking and reporting so decisions are data-driven (UTMs, attribution basics, lead source tracking, dashboard visibility).

- Faster lead response time, better booking flow, and improved show-up/follow-up consistency 

- We can see what’s working weekly, and what to improve next.



Required experience:

- Proven GrowthHub 365 experience across websites/funnels, CRM, automations,
/SMS, integrations, reporting

- Ability to provide proof of work (portfolio screenshots or Loom walkthroughs; sensitive info blurred)

- Strong automation logic skills (triggers, conditions, tags, segmentation, fail-safes)

- Comfortable with domain/DNS basics (subdomains, SSL, CNAME/A records) and troubleshooting



Bonus Skills (nice-to-have):

- Appointment setting + calendar optimization inside GH365

- Lead source tracking and attribution setup (UTMs, consistent reporting)

- Experience building for coaches/consultants/service businesses

- Copywriting/editing for high-converting pages (not required, but helpful)



Working Hours / Commitment:

- Part-time to start (10–20 hrs/week), potential to grow based on performance.

- Must overlap at least 2–3 hours with Eastern Time (for communication).

- Long-term role for the right person.



Pay:

Competitive based on skill + proof. Please include your hourly rate and expected monthly range.

How to Apply (this is how we filter for experts):

Reply with:



Your GrowthHub 365 experience summary (how long + what you’ve built).

- A portfolio: 2–3 examples (screenshots, links, or Loom videos).

- A Loom video (3–7 minutes) walking through one GrowthHub 365 account you built (you can blur private info).

- Answer this: What are the top 3 mistakes you see in GrowthHub 365 builds, and how do you fix them?

- Confirm you can handle: building and maintaining websites/funnels, CRM, automations,
/SMS, integrations, reporting.



I am looking for someone who can work a few hours a day Mon- Friday Eastern time zone. Flexible hours to be discussed. With the possibility to go more when time permits. During this time you must be present and available in real time. No exception.



There will be zero training. I am looking for people who are already experienced. Must speak and communicate in English, proficiently.



When you respond please include answers to the following questions in your cover letter response. Applications without the following answers will be automatically deleted.



Assessment (short paid test):

Final candidates will complete a small paid task: set up a mini funnel + pipeline + automation + basic reporting.

title: Social Community Manager
description:
About Dulcedo



Dulcedo Management began as a high-profile modeling agency and has since evolved into the largest multidisciplinary talent management group in Canada and a leading force in North America. With a steadfast commitment to excellence, our reach extends across all spheres of entertainment, from our offices in Montreal and Toronto to remote collaborations worldwide.



Our talented team of Agents and Account Managers represent and manage the national and international careers of over 500 models, hundreds of Olympic and professional athletes, top-tier digital influencers, content creators, and streamers.



Dulcedo is, above all, a community of incredible individuals who “work hard but play harder.” Our team is united, welcoming, and inclusive, with company culture remaining a top priority. Proudly certified as a Great Place to Work for two consecutive years, our mission is to empower our employees by creating an environment where work feels motivating, creative, and meaningful.



The Opportunity

We’re looking for a strategic, culture-driven, and highly engaged Community Manager to nurture and grow our digital and talent-facing communities. This role is ideal for someone who understands the creator economy, thrives in fast-paced environments, and genuinely loves building meaningful relationships online and offline. You’ll play a key role in strengthening engagement between Dulcedo, our talents, our audiences, and our partners - ensuring our community feels connected, inspired, and aligned with our brand voice.



As Dulcedo continues expanding its international presence, this position offers real opportunity to shape how we cultivate and activate our community at scale.



Scope of Work

Community Engagement & Growth

Build and nurture relationships with our talents, creators, and digital audiences.

Actively engage across social platforms (Instagram, TikTok, YouTube, LinkedIn, etc.), responding to comments, DMs, and community inquiries.

Develop initiatives to increase engagement, loyalty, and brand affinity.

Identify emerging creators, cultural trends, and community opportunities.

Monitor audience sentiment and feedback.

Assist in organizing online and in-person community activations when required.

Track engagement, growth, and community performance metrics.

Analyze trends and provide insights to optimize strategy.

Prepare monthly community reports with actionable recommendations.





Your Profile

+5 years of experience in community management, social media, or influencer marketing.

Strong understanding of social media platforms and digital culture.

Exceptional communication skills (written and verbal) in English

Strong organizational skills: you're a pro at managing tasks & staying on top of priorities.

Excellent time management and a proactive attitude.

Familiar with Canva for simple design tasks like templates and formatting.

Positive, personable, approachable and you enjoy being part of a collaborative team!



Work Parameters & Perks of Working with Dulcedo

Schedule: Full-time

Work hours aligned with Eastern Time Zone

13th month pay to reward your dedication!

Opportunities to grow. As we build our remote team, you’ll have chances to expand your role!

Mentorship & support because we prioritize people, learning, and your success.

A fun, dynamic environment where collaboration and creativity are part of daily life.

Work from home with a full-time schedule synced with the Eastern Time Zone.

Join a close-knit team where your work has real impact and your contributions are valued.

title: Afterhours Driver Support Specialist
description:
TO APPLY CLICK HERE: 



We are currently seeking a dedicated Afterhours Driver Support Specialist to join our team, with weekend shifts required. The primary role of this position is to ensure that our drivers experience a smooth journey, particularly during late hours when support is crucial.



The key responsibilities include being the initial point of contact for drivers facing issues during the night shift, listening to their concerns, empathizing, and resolving them efficiently. The specialist will also collaborate within the company's communication channels (Slack) to tag the appropriate dispatchers and drivers for prompt assistance. Additionally, this role involves guiding drivers through any load, receiver, or shipper issues they encounter after hours, ensuring their operations remain on track. The specialist will use our system, TMS, to identify load numbers, then contact brokers to get necessary directions, helping drivers reach their destinations smoothly.



You will be working 8-hour shifts with at least one more tea
mber assigned to each shift. Although two rest days are offered every week, they might not necessarily be on Saturday and Sunday.



*Key Responsibilities:

- Handle After Hours Hours Driver Problems: Act as the primary contact for drivers with issues during night shifts, providing empathetic and efficient solutions.

- Tag Dispatchers and Drivers: Work within the company communication channels to ensure timely and accurate information flow between dispatchers and drivers.

- Assist with Load, Receiver, and Shipper Issues: Guide drivers through problems related to loads, receivers, or shippers, maintaining schedule adherence.

- Navigate TMS: Use the company’s system to find load numbers, contact brokers for directions, and assist drivers in reaching their destinations efficiently.



*Qualifications:

- Experience: Proven sales experience, preferably in logistics, transportation, or a related field.

- Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to present complex information clearly.

- Self-Starter: Ability to work independently and take initiative to achieve goals.

- Tech-Savvy: Comfortable using computer software tools and understanding basic logistics software solutions.

- Problem-Solving: Ability to think on your feet and address potential partner concerns effectively.



*Why Join Spotter?

- Comprehensive Training: You will go through a two week comprehensive training course that pays $150 per week stipend to start.

- Competitive Salary: Attractive commission structure.

- Paid PTO: Up to 10 days per year of paid time off.

- Growth Opportunities: Be part of a rapidly growing company with room for career advancement.

- Innovative Culture: Work with a team that values creativity, collaboration, and continuous improvement.

title: Website Project Manager
description:
About Us

Door & Gate Domination is a high-performance digital agency specializing in website design, development, and marketing solutions tailored to the garage door and gate industry across the U.S.

We are seeking a highly organized, proactive, and accountable Project Manager to oversee workflow, timelines, and cross-department coordination across SEO and Web projects.

This role ensures projects move efficiently from strategy to execution — on time, on scope, and without bottlenecks.



Role Overview

The Project Manager is responsible for operational excellence across client accounts and internal initiatives.

This role focuses on:

• Managing project timelines and deliverables

• Coordinating SEO, Web Dev, Content, and QA teams

• Ensuring tasks are clearly assigned and completed on schedule

• Monitoring workload capacity and preventing bottlenecks

• Driving accountability and follow-up across departments

• Maintaining organized systems and documentation

The Project Manager acts as the operational backbone of the agency — ensuring execution matches strategy.

mbers
